Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: When paying costs that say "discard to the Graveyard", if "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is being applied, so that cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, the activation of cards that discard to the Graveyard as a cost cannot be performed. Costs that simply say "discard" can be paid. In that case, the cards are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished as a result[].

If "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is activated, so that cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, discarded cards are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead. Cards banished in this way are treated as being banished by a card effect, even if they were discarded as cost[].
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.example:
Question:
I activate "Super Polymerization", or activate "Fallen of Albaz"' effect, by discarding "Despian Tragedy" as a cost.
After this activation resolves, can the effect of "Despian Tragedy", which activates if it is sent to the Graveyard or banished by a card effect, be activated?
Answer:
In this case, "Despian Tragedy" was discarded as a cost to activate an effect. It was not sent to the Graveyard by a card effect. Thus, the effect of "Despian Tragedy" cannot be activated.
The effect of "Despian Tragedy" is an effect that can be activated when "Despian Tragedy" is sent to the Graveyard by a card effect, or is banished.
However, if the situation above occurs while the effect of "Macro Cosmos" is applying, the "Despian Tragedy" will not be discarded to the Graveyard. Instead, it will be banished by the effect of "Macro Cosmos". As "Despian Tragedy" was banished by a card effect, the effect of "Despian Tragedy" can then be activated.
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Despian Tragedy", "Fallen of Albaz", "Super Polymerization", "Macro Cosmos"

Leaves the field.interaction: When a monster on the field is shuffled into the Deck, it is no longer a card on the field, however its effects that activate when it "leaves the field" will not activate[]. Deck includes both Main and Extra Deck.

Banish it when it leaves the field.interaction: If a card will be banished when it leaves the field, it cannot be returned to the hand as a cost to activate the effect of a card (1) that requires to do so, therefore (1) cannot be activated[].
Banish it when it leaves the field.example:
Question:
Can I return "Plaguespreader Zombie" Special Summoned with its own effect to Special Summon "Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite" with its own effect?
Answer:
Since "Plaguespreader Zombie" was Special Summoned with its own effect, it will be banished when it leaves the field, so you cannot be returned to the hand as a cost to activate the effect of "Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite".
If "Plaguespreader Zombie" that was Special Summoned by its own effect becomes an Equip Card due to the effect "Immortal Phoenix Gearfried", the part of the effect that makes "Plaguespreader Zombie" being banished when it leaves the field is no longer applied. In that situation, you can return "Plaguespreader Zombie" that is equipped to "Immortal Phoenix Gearfried" as a cost to activate the effect of "Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite".
Banish it when it leaves the field.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Plaguespreader Zombie", "Blackwing - Zephyros the Elite", "Immortal Phoenix Gearfried"

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: For costs that read "send to the Graveyard;", those cards must be sent to the Graveyard in order to activate the effect. If "Macro Cosmos" or similar is being applied, so that the cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished instead and so that it is not possible to send cards to the Graveyard, activations that send cards to the Graveyard as a cost cannot be performed[].
When the effect "any Monster sent to the GY is banished instead" is applying you cannot activate a card or effect that requires you to send a Monster to the Graveyard as a cost[].

When the effect "any Monster sent to the GY is banished instead" is applying you cannot activate a card or effect that send cards from the top of your Deck to the Graveyard as cost as there may be monster cards among them[].

When the effect "any Monster sent to the GY is banished instead" is applying you can activate a card or effect that requires you to send a Monster Card not treated as a Monster (for example treated as an Equip Spell Card) to the Graveyard as a cost[].
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.example:
Question:
If the effect of "Dimensional Fissure" is applied, you cannot send monsters to the Graveyard as a cost to activate a card or an effect, but is it possible to send a card such a Union Monster treated as an Equip Spell Card to the Graveyard as a cost to activate the effect of "Guardian Eatos"?
Answer:
Even if the effect of "Dimensional Fissure" is applied, you can send cards such as Union Monsters treated as Equip Spell Cards to the Graveyard as a cost to activate the effect of "Guardian Eatos".
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Guardian Eatos", "Dimensional Fissure"

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: When the effect "any Monster sent to the GY is banished instead" is applying you can activate a card or effect that requires you to send a Trap Card summoned as a monster (either not treated as a Trap or still treated as a Trap) to the Graveyard as a cost[].
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.example:
Question:
I control an "Angel Statue - Azurune", which was Special Summoned by its own effect, and the effect of "Dimensional Fissure" (or "Ryu-Ge Realm - Wyrm Winds") is applying. Can I activate "Angel Statue - Azurune"'s effect by "send[ing ...] 1 Continuous Trap in your Monster Zone that was Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone [to the Graveyard]?"
Answer:
Yes, you can.
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Angel Statue - Azurune", "Dimensional Fissure", "Ryu-Ge Realm - Wyrm Winds"

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: For costs that tribute, if "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is being applied, so that monsters that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, you can still Tribute monsters. In that case, the Tributed monsters are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

Banish until - Temporarily banish.interaction: If "the effect(s) of this card can only be activated once per turn" or simply "once per turn:" is written (different from "the effect of [card name] can only be activated/used once per turn"), if that card is flipped face-down or leaves the field and it later appears on the field face-up once again, the same effect of cards with the same name can be activated[].

If "the effect of [card name] can only be used once per turn" is written with a particular card name, if that card leaves the field and returns to the field in the same turn, that card or cards with the same name cannot activate that effect in that turn. The same applies if "can only be used once per Duel" is written[].

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If "the effect(s) of this card can only be activated once per turn" or simply "once per turn:" is written (different from "the effect of [card name] can only be activated/used once per turn"), if control switches to the opponent, the effect cannot be activated[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example:
Question:
The turn player has activated the effect of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" that negates the activation of a Spell/Trap Card. If control of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" is now changed due to "Enemy Controller"'s effect, can the opponent also activate the effect of that same "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" this turn?
Answer:
If you have already used that effect of "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" this turn, your opponent cannot use the same effect of that "Legendary Six Samurai - Shi En" this turn, even if they take control of it.
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Unqualified 'once per turn' and change of control

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If "the effect of [card name] can only be used once per turn" is written with a particular card name, if control switches to the opponent, monsters with the same name that the opponent controls can activate that effect[].

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: If "the effect(s) of this card can only be activated once per turn" or simply "once per turn:" is written (different from "the effect of [card name] can only be activated/used once per turn"), if that card is flipped face-down or leaves the field and it later appears on the field face-up once again, the same effect of cards with the same name can be activated[].

If "the effect of [card name] can only be used once per turn" is written with a particular card name, if that card leaves the field and returns to the field in the same turn, that card or cards with the same name cannot activate that effect in that turn. The same applies if "can only be used once per Duel" is written[].

Change Name.interaction: If an effect reads "You can only use this effect of [card name] once per turn" or "You can only use the effect of a card with this name once per turn", this is not influenced by changes to the card's name on the field[].
Change Name.example: If the effect of "Giant Pairfish" that says "You can discard 1 monster; Special Summon 1 Level 4 or lower Wyrm-Type monster from your Deck. You can only use this effect of "Giant Pairfish" once per turn." is activated, and later its name changes by the effect of another card, the effect of the "Giant Pairfish" that had its name changed during that turn cannot be activated.

Copy effect continuous/lingering.interaction: If the effects of another monster are gained by an effect that gains effects, the requirements to use that effect like "can only activate the effect of [card name] once per turn" are also applied[].
Copy effect continuous/lingering.example:
Question:
I control two "Therion" monsters, each equipped with a "Therion "Reaper" Fum". Due to the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum", both of these monsters have gained the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum", which allows me to return cards on the field to the hand.
During a single turn, can I activate both of these monsters' respective effect gained by "Therion "Reaper" Fum"?
Answer:
You can only activate that effect of one of these monsters.
You are considered to be using the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum" not only if you activate that effect of a "Therion "Reaper" Fum", but also if you activate that effect that another monster has gained due to the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum".
"Therion "Reaper" Fum"'s card text tells you that you can only use the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum" once per turn. Therefore, you cannot use the effect of "Therion "Reaper" Fum" twice during the same turn, even if different monsters have that effect.
Copy effect continuous/lingering.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters gaining the effects of other monsters, and once-per-turn restrictions

Copy effect resolves as another card's e.interaction: Copying activated effects and named once per turn restrictions: this kind of effect "ignores" named once per turn restrictions[].
Copy effect resolves as another card's e.example:
Question:
Can you activate "Urgent Ritual Art" by banishing "Nekroz Kaleidoscope" during a turn in which the Ritual Summoning effect of "Nekroz Kaleidoscope" has been used?
Answer:
While resolving the effect of "Urgent Ritual Art", the effect of the banished Ritual Spell Card is performed as the resolution of the effect of "Urgent Ritual Art".
Therefore, even in that case, "Urgent Ritual Art" can be activated by banishing "Nekroz Kaleidoscope".
Copy effect resolves as another card's e.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Copying activated effects and named once per turn restrictions

Pendulum Monsters.interaction: When a Pendulum Monster Card is sent from the field to the Graveyard, it is added face-up to the Extra Deck, instead. Therefore, you cannot send a Pendulum Monster Card to the Graveyard in order to Special Summon a monster using its listed procedure that says "send cards to the Graveyard". This is the case only for summoning procedures that exactly say "send to the Graveyard"[].
Pendulum Monsters.example:
Question:
If Timegazer Magician is treated as a Machine-Type monster because of DNA Surgery, can it and Cyber Dragon be sent to the Graveyard to Special Summon "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon"?
Can I send a Spellcaster Pendulum Monster Card, and/or a Synchro Pendulum Monster Card, from my field to the Graveyard in order to Special Summon "Magistus Chorozo"?
Answer:
No, you cannot.
When a Pendulum Monster Card is sent from the field to the Graveyard, it is added face-up to the Extra Deck, instead. Therefore, you cannot send a Pendulum Monster Card to the Graveyard in order to Special Summon "Magistus Chorozo" using its listed procedure.
Pendulum Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon", "G.B. Hunter" and Pendulum Monsters

Pendulum Monsters.interaction: However, note that as an exception to the general rule above, if the "cards on the field cannot be returned to the Deck" effect of "G.B. Hunter" is applying, you will be able to succeed in sending a Pendulum Monster Card from the field to the Graveyard, and therefore can also send a Pendulum Monster Card you control to the Graveyard in order to Special Summon a monster using its listed procedure that says "send cards to the Graveyard"[].
Pendulum Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon", "G.B. Hunter" and Pendulum Monsters

Tokens.interaction: When Special Summoning a monster with its own procedure, a Token on the field can be banished and the monster is summoned normally[].
Tokens.example:
Question:
When Special Summoning "The Atmosphere" from my hand with its own procedure, can I banish a Token(s) such as "Sheep Token" on my field?
Also, when Special Summoning "Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon", can I banish a Token that is a Dragon on my field?
Answer:
You can Special Summon "The Atmosphere" and "Red-Eyes Darkness Metal Dragon" using a Token as described in the given situations.
Tokens.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "The Atmosphere" and Tokens

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: While the effect of "Macro Cosmos", cards sent to the Graveyard are banished instead, therefore you cannot "send cards to the Graveyard" as part of a Special Summoning procedure. This is the case only for summoning procedures that exactly say "send to the Graveyard"[].
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.example:
Question:
The effect of "Macro Cosmos" is applying, banishing any cards that would be sent to the Graveyard. In this situation, is it possible to Special Summon "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon" by banishing ""Cyber Dragon"" + 1+ Machine monsters?
Furthermore, if the effect of "Macro Cosmos" is negated by "Jinzo", can I send that "Jinzo" to the Graveyard in order to Special Summon "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon"?
Answer:
While the effect of "Macro Cosmos" is applying, cards sent to the Graveyard are banished instead. Therefore, you cannot send cards to the Graveyard as part of a Special Summoning procedure, and therefore cannot Special Summon "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon" from the Extra Deck.
Furthermore, if the effects of "Macro Cosmos" are negated by the effect of "Jinzo", and that "Jinzo" is sent to the Graveyard, it would be banished by "Macro Cosmos"' effect. Therefore, you cannot send that "Jinzo" to the Graveyard as part of a Special Summoning procedure while both it and "Macro Cosmos" are face-up on the field.
Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Chimeratech Fortress Dragon", "Macro Cosmos"

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: A monster you control that leaves the field because used as a material (for example as Tribute or Link material) for an opponent's monster summoning procedures, it counts as having left the field by your opponent's card[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.example:
Question:
I control a Fusion Summoned "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon", and my opponent Tributes it to Special Summon "Gadarla, the Mystery Dust Kaiju" to my field. Can its effect when it leaves the field be activated?
Also, if my opponent sends that "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" to the Graveyard as Link Material for the Link Summon of "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World", can its effect be activated?
Answer:
That effect can be activated in both cases. ("Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" is considered to have left the field by the opponent).
Furthermore, when "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect is then resolved during the End Phase, "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World" will be destroyed by it.
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Leaves the field by your opponent" and Summoning procedures

Unaffected.interaction: The text "You can also use 1 monster your opponent controls as material to Link Summon this card" of "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World" is not an effect, therefore an opponent's monster that is unaffected by monster effects can still be used as a Link Material[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Underworld Goddess of the Closed World" using an opponent's monster that is unaffected

Unaffected.interaction: The text "You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) to your opponent's field in Attack Position, by Tributing 1 monster they control" of a "Kaiju" Monster is not an effect, therefore an opponent's monster that is unaffected by monster effects can still be tributed[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Metaltron XII, the True Dracombatant", "Kumongous, the Sticky String Kaiju"

\"Necrovalley\".interaction: If you Special Summon a Special Summon Monster from the Graveyard using the procedure described in its card text, this is not treated as a Special Summon performed by a card effect. Therefore, since this is not a card effect being applied to cards in the Graveyard (as described in "Necrovalley"'s text), you can Special Summon such monsters this way[].
\"Necrovalley\".example:
Question:
"Necrovalley" is face-up in my opponent's Field Zone, and its effect is applying.
In this situation, can I Special Summon "Infernoid Onuncu" using the "by banishing 3 "Infernoid" monsters from your hand or Graveyard" procedure listed in its text?
Answer:
If you Special Summon a Special Summon Monster using the procedure described in its card text, this is not treated as a Special Summon performed by a card effect. Therefore, since this is not a card effect being applied to cards in the Graveyard (as described in "Necrovalley"'s text), you can Special Summon "Infernoid Onuncu" this way.
However, note that the effect of "Necrovalley" that prevents players from banishing cards from the Graveyard is also applying. This prevents you from banishing cards from the Graveyard, regardless of whether a card effect is doing so.
Therefore, in order to Special Summon "Infernoid Onuncu", you will need to banish 3 "Infernoid" monsters from your hand.
\"Necrovalley\".reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Necrovalley" and Special Summon monsters

Copy effect continuous/lingering.interaction: Copying the effect of a card does not copy the maintenance cost[].
Copy effect continuous/lingering.example: If "Legendary Knight Hermos" gains the effects of "Koa'ki Meiru Overload", the text that says "During each of your End Phases, destroy this card unless you send 1 "Iron Core of Koa'ki Meiru" from your hand to the Graveyard or reveal 1 Rock-Type monster in your hand." is not applied.

Declare 1 card name.interaction: A card named [X] whose text reads "this card's name is always treated as [Y]" cannot be declared by card name: when activating an effect that involves declaring a card name, you cannot declare [X] but you can declare [Y][].
Declare 1 card name.example:
Question:
The card names ""A Legendary Ocean"" and ""Lemuria, the Forgotten City"" are always treated as ""Umi"".
For cards that have me declare a card name, such as "Crossout Designator", can I declare ""A Legendary Ocean"" or ""Lemuria, the Forgotten City""?
Answer:
When declaring a card name, you cannot declare the card names ""A Legendary Ocean"" or ""Lemuria, the Forgotten City"".
Both ""A Legendary Ocean"" and ""Lemuria, the Forgotten City"" are card names that are always treated as ""Umi"". Therefore, the original card name of these cards while they are being used in a Duel will also be ""Umi"".
As a result, if you declare ""Umi"" when activating "Crossout Designator", you can banish either "Umi", "A Legendary Ocean", or "Lemuria, the Forgotten City" when "Crossout Designator" resolves. Regardless of which one you banish, the effect of "Crossout Designator" will apply to all cards whose original name is ""Umi"", which includes the cards "A Legendary Ocean" and "Lemuria, the Forgotten City".
The same goes for cards such as "Harpie Lady 1" or "Cyber Harpie Lady", for which you would need to declare ""Harpie Lady"".
(TL note: This is talking about game mechanics. You cannot single out a particular "Umi" retrain with "Crossout Designator", you always get all of them as a package deal. It is not talking about policies that describe how "declaring a card name" is handled in actual play.)
Declare 1 card name.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Umi", "Crossout Designator"

Change Name.interaction: Archetype inclusion/exclusion "this card is always treated as [a particular title/archetype] card" clauses apply to a particular card name, not to a particular card: copying the name of a card with such clauses will copy also the "[a particular title/archetype]" clause[].
Change Name.example:
Question:
I activate the effect of "Crystal Rose", and when it resolves, I send "Brilliant Rose" to the Graveyard.
As a result, the name of "Crystal Rose" is now treated as ""Brilliant Rose"". Will it also be treated as a "Gem-Knight" card due to "Brilliant Rose"'s text?
Answer:
Yes, it is also treated as a "Gem-Knight" card.
Change Name.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Archetype inclusion/exclusion clauses apply to a particular card name, not to a particular card

Can only control 1 - \"Rivalry of Warlor.interaction: If a monster was flipped face-up during the Damage Step and "Rivalry of Warlords"/"Gozen Match" is still active, if that monster has a Attribute/Type that conflicts with another monster already face-up on the field, the flipped monster will immediately be sent to the Graveyard at this point (After damage calculation), and Flip Effects will not activate[].
Can only control 1 - \"Rivalry of Warlor.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Rivalry of Warlords" and face-down monsters

Reveal.interaction: Revealing a card does not activate its Flip effects[].

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: You activate the effect of an Union Monster (1) that targets another monster (2) on your field and equips to it. If an effect (3) is chained that changes (1) to face-down Defense Position, when resolving the effect of (1), the effect is not applied (the face-down Defense Position (1) remains in the Monster Zone)[].
Change to face-down Defense Position.example:
Question:
I activate the effect of "Heavy Mech Support Armor" that equips it to a Machine-Type monster on my field, targeting "XYZ-Dragon Cannon". If "Book of Moon" is chained, and "Heavy Mech Support Armor" itself is changed to face-down Defense Position, how does its effect resolve?
Answer:
In this scenario, when resolving the effect of "Heavy Mech Support Armor", if it has been changed to face-down Defense Position, the effect is not applied. (The face-down Defense Position "Heavy Mech Support Armor" remains in the Monster Zone.)
Change to face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Heavy Mech Support Armor", "Book of Moon"

Equipping Monsters.interaction: If a Monster Card is equipped to another monster, it remains equipped to that monster and cannot be moved to a different target, even by card effects that would normally be able to do so. Exception being Union monsters: Union monsters equipped by their own effects can be moved by appropriate card effects[]

Negate Effects.interaction: If the effects of an Equip Card equipped to a monster are negated, the effects are negated but it remains on the field equipped to the equipped monster[].
Negate Effects.example: While the Union monster "Armored Cybern" is equipped to a monster, if the effect of "Silent Swordsman LV7" that says "Negate all Spell effects on the field." is applied, the effects of "Armored Cybern" are negated but it stays equipped to the equipped monster.

Banish until - Temporarily banish.interaction: A Gemini Monster that has been normal summoned again and gained its effects, if banished temporarily and subsequently returned to the field, it is treated as a Normal Monster again and its gained effect is no longer applied[].
Banish until - Temporarily banish.example:
Question:
"Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is Special Summoned by the effect of "A Hero Lives", and then Normal Summoned again so that its effect that treats its name as "Elemental HERO Neos" is applying. Afterward, "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter", and then returned to the field during the End Phase. In this case, is it possible to equip "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" with "Bashing Shield"?
Answer:
In this scenario, after "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" and subsequently returned to the field, it is treated as a Normal Monster again and its effect that treats its name as "Elemental HERO Neos" is no longer applied. Even in this case, "Elemental HERO Neos Alius" is still treated as a Normal Summoned monster, and so it can be equipped with "Bashing Shield".
Banish until - Temporarily banish.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Temporary banishment and Normal-Summoned-Again status

Equipping Monsters.interaction: Gemini monsters treated as Equip Cards are not treated as Normal monsters[].
Equipping Monsters.example:
Question:
An Poly-Chemicritter Dioxogre that has been Normal Summoned again as an Effect Monster is face-up on my field. In this situation, if I activate the effect of "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest" and equip my opponent's Poly-Chemicritter Dioxogre to it, and then apply the effect of "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest" to use the equipped monster for a Fusion Summon, can I treat Poly-Chemicritter Dioxogre as a Normal Monster for the Fusion Summon?
Answer:
If "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest" is equipped with a Gemini monster, when performing a Fusion Summon by using that equipped monster, you cannot treat it as a Normal Monster. For example, if you activate "Metalfoes Fusion" in this situation, you could not use "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest" and the equipped Poly-Chemicritter Dioxogre to Fusion Summon another "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest". You could however use "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest" and the equipped Poly-Chemicritter Dioxogre to Fusion Summon "Metalfoes Adamante".
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Fullmetalfoes Alkahest" and Gemini monsters

Cannot summon - Summon restrictions.interaction: Summoning a Gemini monster from the Graveyard is treated as summoning a normal monster, even if it will gain its effects on the moment its summon is successful: if an effect is applying that prevents Effect monsters to be summoned, you can still Special Summon a Gemini monster from the Graveyard[].
Cannot summon - Summon restrictions.example:
Question:
Can the effect of "Blazewing Butterfly" to Special Summon a Gemini monster from the Graveyard be activated while the effect of "Heat Wave" is applying?
Answer:
Even if the effect of "Heat Wave" is applying, you can activate the effect of "Blazewing Butterfly" to Special Summon a Gemini monster from your Graveyard. The targeted monster will be Special Summoned and treated as an Effect Monster as usual.
Cannot summon - Summon restrictions.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Blazewing Butterfly", "Heat Wave"

Negate Effects.interaction: Gemini monsters which are treated as Normal Monsters by their "This card is treated as a Normal Monster while face-up on the field or in the Graveyard." effect are also monsters to which the "its effects are negated" effect can be applied[].
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Activation legality for effect negation

Negate Effects.interaction: If a Gemini monster has its effects negated, it also cannot be Normal Summoned again[].
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Normal Summoning a negated Gemini Monster

Negate Effects.interaction: If a Gemini monster treated as a Normal Monster has its effects negated, the effect that says "This card is treated as a Normal Monster while face-up on the field or in the Graveyard" is negated and it is treated as an Effect Monster[].
If a Gemini monster treated as an Effect Monster has its effects negated, the effects after the "â€¢" are negated and it is treated as an Effect Monster[].
Negate Effects.example: A Gemini monster that is attacked and destroyed in battle by "Dark Ruler Ha Des" has its effects negated by the effect of "Dark Ruler Ha Des" that says "Negate the effects of monsters destroyed by battle with Fiend-Type monsters you control", and it is treated as an Effect Monster as long as it is in the Graveyard.

Negate Summons.interaction: When a Gemini monster is Normal Summoned a second time, you can activate cards to negate the summon. If the Summon is negated, the Gemini monster will be sent from the field to the Graveyard[].
Negate Summons.example:
Question:
If you Normal Summon a Gemini monster such as "Chthonian Emperor Dragon" a second time, can "Horn of Heaven" or "Solemn Judgment" be activated to negate the Normal Summon?
If it is possible, will the Gemini monster be sent from the field to the Graveyard?
Answer:
When a Gemini monster is Normal Summoned a second time, you can activate "Horn of Heaven" etc. to negate the summon. If the Summon is negated, the Gemini monster will be sent from the field to the Graveyard.
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Horn of Heaven", "Chthonian Emperor Dragon"

Negate Summons.interaction: During an attempt to Normal or Special Summon a monster from a location outside the field, the monster is not yet on the field. If the Summon of the monster is negated, then the monster is never considered to have been on the field. On the other hand, during an attempt to Flip Summoned or Normal Summoned again (Gemini monsters) a monster already on the field, the monster is considered to be on the field[].
Negate Summons.example:
Question:
If "Solemn Judgment" is activated during an attempt to Normal, Flip or Special Summon a monster, can "Destruction Jammer" be activated in response?
Answer:
If "Solemn Judgment" is activated during an attempt to Normal or Special Summon a monster, "Destruction Jammer" cannot be activated in response. (Since the monster to be destroyed is not yet on the field, "Solemn Judgment" is not considered to be an effect that destroys cards on the field.)
If "Solemn Judgment" is activated during an attempt to Flip Summon, or an attempt to Normal Summon a Gemini Monster again, "Destruction Jammer" can be activated in response. (In these cases, "Solemn Judgment" is considered to be an effect that destroys cards on the field.)
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Solemn Judgment", "Destruction Jammer"

Copy effect continuous/lingering.interaction: If the effects of a Gemini Monster (1) are gained by a Monster (2) that has an effect that gains effects, (2) will be treated as a Normal Monster, but can be Normal Summoned again to gain the listed effect of (1)[].
Copy effect continuous/lingering.example:
Question:
If I activate "Neo-Spacian Dark Panther"'s effect by targeting a Gemini monster such as "Chthonian Emperor Dragon", what happens?
Answer:
"Neo-Spacian Dark Panther" will gain the effects of the targeted Gemini monster. As a result, it will be treated as a Normal Monster, but can be Normal Summoned again to gain the listed effect.
Copy effect continuous/lingering.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Neo-Spacian Dark Panther", "Chthonian Emperor Dragon"

Properties Changing - Gains this effect.interaction: If a monster that is not an Effect Monster gains an effect by the effect of another card that says "gains this effect [effect]", that monster is treated as an Effect Monster[].
Properties Changing - Gains this effect.example: Since a "Gem-Knight Pearl" Xyz Summoned by using "Gagaga Head" as Xyz Materials gains the effect that says "â— If it is Xyz Summoned: Draw 1 card.", it is treated as an Effect Monster.

Tokens.interaction: Monster Tokens on the field can also be Tributed. In that case, Tokens that would be sent to the Graveyard are removed from the Duel[].

Xyz Monsters.interaction: Since Xyz Monsters do not have a Level, they cannot be used for the tributes of a Ritual Summon[].

Link Monsters.interaction: Since Link Monsters do not have a Level, they cannot be used for the tributes of a Ritual Summon[].

Negate Summons.interaction: The Ritual Summon is performed as the resolution of the effect of the Ritual Spell Card. As a result, when a Ritual Spell Card is activated and the resolution is entered, cards cannot be activated until the Ritual Summon is successful[].
Negate Summons.example: "Nekroz Mirror" was activated, during the resolution of that, Effect Monsters were Tributed and afterwards, "Nekroz of Clausolas" was Ritual Summoned. Since the Ritual Summon has already been performed by the time the resolution ends, the opponent cannot activate cards like "Grand Horn of Heaven" to negate the Ritual Summon.

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be tributed. In that case, the Tributed Trap Cards are sent to the Graveyard[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be tributed. In that case, the Tributed Trap Cards are sent to the Graveyard[].

Link Monsters.interaction: Link Monsters can also be used as Fusion Materials[].

Tokens.interaction: Token Monsters on the field can also be used as Fusion Materials. In that case, the Tokens are not sent to the Graveyard and they are removed from the Duel[].

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: Even if an effect like "Macro Cosmos" is being applied, so that monsters that are sent to the Graveyard are banished, a card that performs a Fusion Summon can be activated and Fusion Summon. In that case, the monsters used as Materials are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

Negate Summons.interaction: The Fusion Summon is performed as the resolution of the effect of the card that performs a Fusion Summon. As a result, when that card is activated and the resolution is entered, cards cannot be activated until the Fusion Summon Summon is successful[].
Negate Summons.example: "Polymerization" was activated, Fusion Materials are sent to the Graveyard during the resolution of that effect and then the Fusion Monster is Fusion Summoned. Since the Fusion Summon has already been performed by the time the resolution ends, the opponent cannot activate cards like "Black Horn of Heaven" that negate the Fusion Summon.

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Fusion Materials. In that case, the Trap Cards used as Materials are sent to the Graveyard[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Fusion Materials. In that case, the Trap Cards used as Materials are sent to the Graveyard[].

Tokens.interaction: Token Monsters can also be used as Synchro Materials. In that case, the Token Monsters are not sent to the Graveyard and are removed from the Duel[].

Xyz Monsters.interaction: Since Xyz do not have a Level, they cannot be used as Synchro Materials[].

Link Monsters.interaction: Since Link Monsters do not have a Level, they cannot be used as Synchro Materials[].

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: Even if an effect like "Macro Cosmos" is being applied, so that monsters sent to the Graveyard are banished, you can still Synchro Summon. In that case, the monsters used as Materials are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Synchro Materials. In that case, the Trap Cards used as Materials are sent to the Graveyard[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Synchro Materials. In that case, the Trap Cards used as Materials are sent to the Graveyard[].

Pendulum Monsters.interaction: A monster treated as an Xyz Material is not treated as a card on the field. The same applies to Pendulum Monsters treated as Xyz Materials. Therefore, if a Pendulum Monster treated as an Xyz Material is detached, since this is not treated as sending a card from the field to the Graveyard, that Pendulum Monster is sent to the Graveyard[].
Pendulum Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Pendulum Monster Cards as Xyz material

Tokens.interaction: Monster Tokens cannot be used as Xyz Materials[].

Link Monsters.interaction: Since Link Monsters do not have a Level or Rank, they cannot be used as Xyz Materials for an Xyz Summon[].

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If an Xyz Monster is flipped face-down, or becomes controlled by the opponent, the Xyz Materials are not sent to the Graveyard. They remain attached to the Xyz Monster[].

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: If an Xyz Monster is flipped face-down, or becomes controlled by the opponent, the Xyz Materials are not sent to the Graveyard. They remain attached to the Xyz Monster[].

Leaves the Field.interaction: When an Xyz Monster leaves the field, all of the Xyz Materials attached to it are sent to the Graveyard[].

Negate Summons.interaction: If the Xyz Summon is negated, the monsters that became Xyz Materials are sent to the Graveyard. Also, in that case, they are not treated as being sent from the field to the Graveyard[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Xyz Materials[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Xyz Materials[].

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: If an effect that says "Any monster sent to the Graveyard is banished instead." is being applied when a Pendulum Monster placed in the Pendulum Zone is destroyed, since it exists on the field as a Spell Card, it is not banished and it is added to the Extra Deck[].

If an effect like "Macro Cosmos" is being applied, so that (all kinds of) cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, the effect text takes precedence and Pendulum Monsters are not added to the Extra Deck and are banished instead[].

Banish until - Temporarily banish.interaction: If a monster that has been temporarily banished from the Extra Monster Zone is returned to the field, it is returned to a Main Monster Zone of its previous controller in the battle position they were in before being banished. At that time, there are no available Main Monster Zones, that monster is not returned to the field and it is sent to the Graveyard[].

Equipping Monsters.interaction: If a Pendulum Monster has been placed in the left-most or right-most Spell & Trap Zone as an Equip Card, that Pendulum Monster is not treated as a card in a Pendulum Zone, its Pendulum Effects are not applied and a Pendulum Summon cannot be performed1].

If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.interaction: A card's effect (1), that prevents a card (2) from being destroyed by sending a card (3) to the graveyard instead, can be applied when (2) would be destroyed even by sending a Pendulum Monster as (3). In this case, (2) will not be destroyed and the Pendulum Monster (3) will not be sent to the Graveyard and will be sent to the Extra Deck face-up[].
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.example:
Question:
On my field, there is only "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss" in the Extra Monster Zone and "Archfiend Eccentrick" in the Main Monster Zone.
In this situation, if "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss" would be destroyed by battle or an opponent's card effect, can I apply its effect and send "Archfiend Eccentrick" to the Graveyard instead?
Answer:
Pendulum Monsters on your field are also cards on your field, so when "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss" would be destroyed by battle or an opponent's card effect, you can apply its effect and choose to send a Pendulum Monster to the Graveyard instead.
In that case, the Pendulum Monster will not be sent to the Graveyard and will be sent to the Extra Deck face-up and "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss" is not destroyed. This would also happen if "Archfiend Eccentrick" was a Spell Card in the Pendulum Zone in this situation.
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss", "Archfiend Eccentrick"

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: If Pendulum Monsters are placed in the Pendulum Zone, this is treated as the activation of a Spell Card. If their activation is negated by the effect of a card that negates the activation of Spells, since they are not treated as being sent from the field to the Graveyard, they are sent to the Graveyard like any other card[].

Negate Summons.interaction: If the Pendulum Summon is negated, all monsters that would have been Special Summoned are sent to the Graveyard. In that case, they are not treated as being sent from the hand, field, or Extra Deck to the Graveyard[].

Tokens.interaction: Token Monsters on the field can also be used as Link Materials. In that case, the Tokens are not sent to the Graveyard and they are removed from the Duel[].

Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banishe.interaction: Even if an effect like "Macro Cosmos" is being applied, it is possible to Link Summon even if the monsters that would be sent to the Graveyard would be banished. In that case, the monsters used as materials are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If you take control of your opponent's monster in the Extra Monster Zone, it moves to your Main Monster Zone. When it goes back to your opponent, it goes to their Main Monster Zone, not the Extra Monster Zone[].

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: Link Monsters have no DEF and cannot ever be in Defense Position. They can't be changed to Defense Position by a card effect. They can't even be flipped into face-down Defense Position[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Link Materials. In that case, the Trap Cards used as Materials are sent to the Graveyard[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: Trap Cards treated as monsters on the field can also be used as Link Materials. In that case, the Trap Cards used as Materials are sent to the Graveyard[].

Banish until - Temporarily banish.interaction: If a monster that has been temporarily banished from the Extra Monster Zone is returned to the field, it is returned to a Main Monster Zone of its previous controller in the battle position they were in before being banished. At that time, there are no available Main Monster Zones, that monster is not returned to the field and it is sent to the Graveyard[].

Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.interaction: Effects that return/add a monster to the hand can be applied on Extra Deck monsters like a Fusion Monster. In that case, the monster is not added/returned to the hand and is returned to the Extra Deck instead. This action is not treated as returning/adding a monster to the hand[].
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.example:
Question:
Can a Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, or Link Monster be targeted for the effect of "Herald of Pure Light"?
Answer:
Yes, they can.
In that case, the targeted monster is not added to the hand and is returned to the Extra Deck instead. Since the targeted Fusion/Synchro/Xyz/Link Monster returns to the Extra Deck instead of your hand, the part of the effect that returns a card in your hand to the Deck is not applied.
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Herald of Pure Light"

Return/Shuffle to the Deck as an effect.interaction: Efffects that return/shuffle a monster to the Deck can be applied on Extra Deck monsters like a Fusion Monster. In that case, the monster is not returned/shuffled to the Main Deck and is returned to the Extra Deck instead. Furthermore, in that case, since no cards were returned to the Deck, the Deck is not shuffled. This action is still treated as returning/shuffling a monster to the deck[].
Return/Shuffle to the Deck as an effect.example:
Question:
If I activate "Pot of Acquisitiveness" by targeting a total of 3 banished Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, and/or Link Monsters, how does it resolve?
Answer:
If you activate "Pot of Acquisitiveness" by targeting a total of 3 banished Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, and/or Link Monsters, those monsters are returned to the Extra Deck instead of the Main Deck. Note that since no cards were returned to the Main Deck, it is not shuffled. After that, you will still draw 1 card normally.
Return/Shuffle to the Deck as an effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Pot of Acquisitiveness"

Banish.interaction: The Token stops existing, but this event is not treated as a card being banished[].
Banish.example:
Question:
Does the effect of "Soul Absorption" activate if a Sheep Token you control is banished by the effect of an opponent's "Caius the Shadow Monarch"?
Answer:
If a Token Monster like a Sheep Token is targeted for the effect of "Caius the Shadow Monarch", at the time it would leave the field it stops existing, and as a result, a card is not banished.
Therefore, in the proposed scenario, the effect of "Soul Absorption" does not activate.
Banish.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Soul Absorption" and Tokens

Banish face-down.interaction: Monster Tokens cannot be banished face-down. Therefore, you cannot target/choose a Token when resolving an effect that banishes a card face-down[].
Banish face-down.example:
Question:
When I resolve "Chaos Scepter Blast"'s "banish 1 card on the field face-down" effect, can I choose a Token?
Also, can I activate "Kashtira Arise-Heart"'s "target 1 card on the field; banish it face-down" effect by targeting a Token?
Answer:
Monster Tokens cannot be banished face-down. Therefore, you cannot choose a Token when resolving "Chaos Scepter Blast"'s effect. You also cannot target a Token when activating "Kashtira Arise-Heart"'s third effect.
Banish face-down.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Chaos Scepter Blast", "Kashtira Arise-Heart" and Tokens

Banish face-down.interaction: Another example with "Evenly Matched"[]:
Banish face-down.example:
Question:
My opponent controls 4 "Sheep Token"s and a "Panther Warrior". If the only card on my field is a Set "Evenly Matched", can I activate it?
Answer:
Yes, you can.
Since Tokens cannot be banished face-down, your opponent will need to banish "Panther Warrior" face-down. (All four "Sheep Token"s remain in the Monster Zone.)
Similarly, if you control a face-up "Kashtira" Xyz Monster, and your opponent controls "Panther Warrior" and 4 "Sheep Token"s, you can activate "Kashtira Big Bang", and your opponent will banish only "Panther Warrior" face-down.
Banish face-down.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Evenly Matched", "Panther Warrior"

Banish until - Temporarily banish.interaction: The Token disappears and won't reapper again even when the effect of temporarily banishing stops applying[].
Banish until - Temporarily banish.example:
Question:
What happens if "S:P Little Knight"'s "banish both until the End Phase" effect resolves targeting both itself and one of the following?
â’¶: A Token
â’·: A monster that was originally a Trap Card, such as "Traptrix Holeutea"
â’¸: A Ritual, Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, or Link Monster that has not been properly Special Summoned
Answer:
â’¶: The targeted Token disappears, and "S:P Little Knight" is banished until the End Phase. (At that point, "S:P Little Knight" returns to the Monster Zone as usual.)
â’·: Both "S:P Little Knight" and "Traptrix Holeutea" are banished, and both return to the Monster Zone during the End Phase. At that point, "Traptrix Holeutea" is immediately sent to the Graveyard.
â’¸: Both monsters are banished, and both monsters return to the Monster Zone normally during the End Phase. (The monsters that return during the End Phase are not being Special Summoned.)
Banish until - Temporarily banish.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "S:P Little Knight" more interactions

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: Monster Tokens cannot be flipped face-down[].

Declare 1 card name.interaction: A Token's name cannot be declared as a "card name"[].
Declare 1 card name.example:
Question:
Can I declare the name of a Token with "Prohibition", such as "Adventurer Token" or "Primal Being Token"?
Answer:
A Token's name cannot be declared as a "card name". Therefore, you cannot activate "Prohibition" by declaring "Adventurer Token" or "Primal Being Token".
Declare 1 card name.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Prohibition" and Tokens

Equipping Monsters.interaction: Tokens placed in the Spell & Trap Zone have the ATK printed on the card that Special Summoned the Token[].
Equipping Monsters.example:
Question:
Can the first effect of "The Grand Jupiter" be activated by targeting a Monster Token?
Answer:
"The Grand Jupiter" can be equipped with a Token by its own effect. For example, if a Photon Token that was Special Summoned by the effect of "Photon Sanctuary" is equipped to "The Grand Jupiter", the second effect of "The Grand Jupiter" will increase its own ATK by the original ATK of the equipped Photon Token, which is 2000. Furthermore, the equipped Photon Token cannot be targeted when activating the last effect of "The Grand Jupiter" that Special Summons one of the monsters equipped to it.
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Tokens placed in the Spell & Trap Zone have the ATK printed on the card that Special Summoned the Token

Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.example:
Question:
Can I target a Token Monster with the effect of "Fairy Tail - Luna"?
Answer:
Yes, you can. When the effect resolves, the Token is removed from the field and "Fairy Tail - Luna" is returned to the hand as normal.
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Fairy Tail - Luna" and Tokens

Send to the Graveyard as an effect.interaction: Since Token Monsters are removed from the duel when they leave the field, they cannot be sent to the Graveyard (as cost) for texts that say "send to the Graveyard;"[].

Special Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum.interaction: Tokens cannot be Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone[].
Special Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum.example:
Question:
Can the first effect of "The Grand Jupiter" be activated by targeting a Monster Token?
Answer:
"The Grand Jupiter" can be equipped with a Token by its own effect. For example, if a Photon Token that was Special Summoned by the effect of "Photon Sanctuary" is equipped to "The Grand Jupiter", the second effect of "The Grand Jupiter" will increase its own ATK by the original ATK of the equipped Photon Token, which is 2000. Furthermore, the equipped Photon Token cannot be targeted when activating the last effect of "The Grand Jupiter" that Special Summons one of the monsters equipped to it.
Special Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Tokens cannot be Special Summoned from the Spell & Trap Zone

Special Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum.interaction: Another example being "Divine Temple of the Snake-Eye": it cannot summon a Token from the Spell/Trap Zone[].
Special Summon from Spell/Trap/Pendulum.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Divine Temple of the Snake-Eye"

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: If a card that has counters placed on itself is flipped face-down, those counters are removed[].

Equipping Monsters.interaction: When a monster with counters on it becomes an Equip Card, it loses any counters on it[].
Equipping Monsters.example:
Question:
"Predaplanet" and a "Predaplant Spinodionaea" with a Predator Counter on it are both face-up on my field. In this situation, my opponent activates the effect of "Thousand-Eyes Restrict" and equips "Predaplant Spinodionaea" to it as an Equip Card. In this case, will the effect of "Predaplanet" that adds a "Preda" card from my Deck to my hand then activate?
Answer:
As in this scenario, when "Predaplant Spinodionaea" becomes an Equip Card by the effect of "Thousand-Eyes Restrict", it is not treated as leaving the field so the effect of "Predaplanet" does not activate. Also, once "Predaplant Spinodionaea" becomes an Equip Card by the effect of "Thousand-Eyes Restrict", it loses any Predator Counters on it, so if it is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard, the effect of "Predaplanet" does not activate.
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Predaplanet", "Predaplant Spinodionaea", "Thousand-Eyes Restrict"

Negate Effects.interaction: If counters that can only be placed on a particular card like itself are placed on a card that has its effects negated, those counters are removed[].
Negate Effects.example: If a "Gateway to Chaos" that had Spell Counters placed on itself by its effect that says "Each time a Monster Card(s) is sent from the hand or field to the Graveyard, place 1 Spell Counter on this card for each of those cards" has its effects negated by an effect like "Silent Swordsman LV7", the Spell Counters are removed.

Negate Effects.interaction: If counters are placed on another card by an effect that places counters, even if the effects of that card are negated, the counters are not removed[].
Negate Effects.example: Ice Counters placed by the effect of "Snowdust Giant" that says "reveal any number of WATER monsters from your hand, and place that many Ice Counters on face-up monsters on the field" are not removed if "Snowdust Giant" has its effects negated.

Unaffected.interaction:
Placing a counter affects the monster[]:
  • A monster (1) that has a counter placed on it and an effect is applying to all monsters with that counter (2). Even if (1) becomes unaffected by cards' effects, the counter is not removed and (2) keeps applying and affecting (1).
  • A monster (1) is unaffected or becomes unaffected by cards' effects. Subsequent effects that try to put counters on (1) will not put any counter on (1).
Unaffected.example:
Question:
A monster has had a Cubic Counter placed on it by the effect of "Vijam the Cubic Seed". As a result, it is unable to attack, and its effects are negated. What happens if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" is then applied to that monster, making it unaffected by card effects?
Answer:
Once a monster has had a Cubic Counter placed on it, even if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" is then applied to the monster, the Cubic Counter is not removed. That monster remains unable to attack, and its effects remain negated.
Conversely, if the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" has already been applied to a monster, and that monster then battles a "Vijam the Cubic Seed" whose effect then resolves, no Cubic Counter will be placed on the monster. (As a result, its effects will not be negated, and it will still be able to attack.)
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Placing a counter affects the monster

Cannot/Neither player can.interaction: If a continuous effect that says "[X] cannot be activated" is applying, you still cannot activate [X] through another card's effect[].
Cannot/Neither player can.example:
Question:
While the effect of "Anti-Spell Fragrance" is applying, can I activate "Metaverse"?
Answer:
The effect of "Metaverse" either adds a Field Spell Card from your Deck to your hand, or activates one from your Deck. In this scenario, you can still activate "Metaverse", but the effect of "Anti-Spell Fragrance" prevents you from activating Spell Cards that were not Set first. Therefore, the Field Spell Card must be added to your hand.
Cannot/Neither player can.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Anti-Spell Fragrance", "Metaverse"

Each time [A] happens, do [B] - Continuo.interaction: Continuous effects that say "Each time [X] is activated, do [B]" won't apply [B] if [X] is activated by another card effect[].
Each time [A] happens, do [B] - Continuo.example:
Question:
If "Demise of the Land" is activated, how many Spell Counters are placed on "Skilled Blue Magician"?
Answer:
Only one Spell Counter is placed on "Skilled Blue Magician". (It is placed as a result of "Demise of the Land"'s own activation.)
If a Spell Card is activated by another effect, "Skilled Blue Magician"'s "each time a Spell Card is activated, place 1 Spell Counter on this card when that Spell resolves" effect will not be applied, and no Spell Counters are placed as a result of that activation.
Each time [A] happens, do [B] - Continuo.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Demise of the Land", "Skilled Blue Magician"

Destroy.interaction: If "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is activated, so that cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, cards that are destroyed are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

Discard as an effect.interaction: If "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is activated, so that cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, discarded cards are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead. Cards banished in this way are treated as being banished by a card effect, even if they were discarded as cost[].
Discard as an effect.example:
Question:
I activate "Super Polymerization", or activate "Fallen of Albaz"' effect, by discarding "Despian Tragedy" as a cost.
After this activation resolves, can the effect of "Despian Tragedy", which activates if it is sent to the Graveyard or banished by a card effect, be activated?
Answer:
In this case, "Despian Tragedy" was discarded as a cost to activate an effect. It was not sent to the Graveyard by a card effect. Thus, the effect of "Despian Tragedy" cannot be activated.
The effect of "Despian Tragedy" is an effect that can be activated when "Despian Tragedy" is sent to the Graveyard by a card effect, or is banished.
However, if the situation above occurs while the effect of "Macro Cosmos" is applying, the "Despian Tragedy" will not be discarded to the Graveyard. Instead, it will be banished by the effect of "Macro Cosmos". As "Despian Tragedy" was banished by a card effect, the effect of "Despian Tragedy" can then be activated.
Discard as an effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Despian Tragedy", "Fallen of Albaz", "Super Polymerization", "Macro Cosmos"

If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.interaction: The effect of "Banisher of the Light", "Macro Cosmos", "Banisher of the Radiance", or "Dimensional Fissure" (1) is applying. A card's effect (2), that prevents a card (3) from being destroyed by sending a card (4) to the graveyard instead, can be applied when (3) would be destroyed even when (1) would banish (4). In this case, (3) will not be destroyed and (4) will be banished by the effect of (1)[].
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.example:
Question:
"Macro Cosmos" is face-up in my opponent's Spell & Trap Zone, and its "Any [X] sent to the Graveyard is banished instead" effect is applying.
In this situation, if a "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss" in my Extra Monster Zone would be destroyed by battle, or by an opponent's card effect, can I apply its "you can send 1 other card you control to the Graveyard instead" effect?
Answer:
Yes, you can.
If you do, the card you choose to be sent to the Graveyard will not end up in the Graveyard, but will be banished by "Macro Cosmos"' effect instead. However, "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss" will not be destroyed, and will remain in the Monster Zone.
(However, note that you need to choose the replacement card from among the cards that are not about to be destroyed. This is the case regardless of whether or not the effect of "Macro Cosmos" is applying.)
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Macro Cosmos "Cherubini, Ebon Angel of the Burning Abyss"

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: The activation condition for an effect that says "if [X] leaves the field because of an opponent's card effect" can (and can only) be activated if the reason for it leaving the field is your opponent's card effect. The effects of "Macro Cosmos" or something similar do not have any impact on the answer to this question[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.example:
Question:
My "Despian Quaeritis" is sent to my Graveyard, but it is instead banished due to the "any (cards/monsters) sent to the Graveyard are banished instead" effect of my opponent's "Macro Cosmos", "Dimensional Fissure" or "Dimension Shifter". Can I now activate "Despian Quaeritis"' second effect, which can be activated if it leaves the field due to my opponent's card effect?
Answer:
The activation condition for "Despian Quaeritis"' effect is "if this face-up card in its owner's control leaves the field because of an opponent's card effect." Therefore, "Despian Quaeritis"' effect can (and can only) be activated if the reason for it leaving the field is your opponent's card effect. The effects of "Dimension Shifter", "Dimensional Fissure" and "Macro Cosmos" do not have any impact on the answer to this question.
For example, if your "Despian Quaeritis" is destroyed by a "Raigeki" that your opponent activated, and banished as a result (due to "Dimension Shifter" etc.), you can activate its effect. If it is destroyed by a "Dark Hole" that you activated, and banished as a result (even if this is due to your opponent's "Dimension Shifter" etc.), you cannot.
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Despian Quaeritis", "Macro Cosmos"

Place a card on the field in your Spell/.interaction: The effect of "Banisher of the Light", "Macro Cosmos", "Banisher of the Radiance", or "Dimensional Fissure" (1) is applying. A card's effect (2), that places a card (3) in the Spell & Trap Zone when (3) is destroyed instead of sending it to the Graveyard, can be applied when (3) would be destroyed even when (1) would banish (3). In this case, (3) will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone. Furthermore, if you choose not to apply (2)'s effect to place (3) there, (3) will be banished by the effect of (1)[].
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.example:
Question:
The effect of "Banisher of the Light", "Macro Cosmos", "Banisher of the Radiance", or "Dimensional Fissure" is applying. If a card such as "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle" is now destroyed, can I place it in the Spell & Trap Zone as a Continuous Spell?
Answer:
Even if an effect such as "Banisher of the Light"'s is applying, "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle" can be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone when it is destroyed.
Furthermore, if you choose not to apply "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle"'s effect to place it there, "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle" will be banished by the effect of "Banisher of the Light" etc.
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Banisher of the Light", "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle"

Send to the Graveyard as an effect.interaction: If "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is activated, so that cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, cards are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

For costs that read "send to the Graveyard;", those monsters must be sent to the Graveyard in order to activate the effect. If "Macro Cosmos" or similar is being applied, so that the cards that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished instead and so that it is not possible to send cards to the Graveyard, activations that send cards to the Graveyard as a cost cannot be performed[].

Tribute as an effect.interaction: If "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is activated, so that monsters that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, monsters can still be Tributed. In that case, the Tributed monsters are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

For costs that tribute, if "Macro Cosmos" or something similar is being applied, so that monsters that would be sent to the Graveyard are banished, you can still Tribute monsters. In that case, the Tributed monsters are not sent to the Graveyard and are banished instead[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: "Dimensional Fissure" is face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone. Both Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated as Traps) and Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated as Traps) won't be banished when destroyed and will be sent to the Graveyard normally[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.example:
Question:
"Dimensional Fissure" is face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone. In this situation, if "The Prime Monarch" and "The First Monarch" were each Special Summoned as monsters by their own effects, and are then destroyed by the effect of "Dark Hole", will they be banished?
Answer:
In this scenario, if "The Prime Monarch" and "The First Monarch" are destroyed by "Dark Hole", neither card is banished and is sent to the Graveyard normally.
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Dimensional Fissure", "The Prime Monarch", "The First Monarch"

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: "Dimensional Fissure" is face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone. Both Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated as Traps) and Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated as Traps) won't be banished when destroyed and will be sent to the Graveyard normally[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
Question:
"Dimensional Fissure" is face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone. In this situation, if "The Prime Monarch" and "The First Monarch" were each Special Summoned as monsters by their own effects, and are then destroyed by the effect of "Dark Hole", will they be banished?
Answer:
In this scenario, if "The Prime Monarch" and "The First Monarch" are destroyed by "Dark Hole", neither card is banished and is sent to the Graveyard normally.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Dimensional Fissure", "The Prime Monarch", "The First Monarch"

Card or effect that includes an effect t.interaction: Cards that say "apply" apply effects at the resolution of it. Therefore no matter what effect is chosen, if at least one of the effects does [A] then it is a "Card or effect that includes an effect that does [A]"[].
Card or effect that includes an effect t.example:
Question:
When my opponent activates the effect of "Doomking Balerdroch" when a Zombie-Type monster's effect is activated, can I chain the effect of "Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion"?
Answer:
You can chain the effect of "Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion" to the effect of your opponent's "Doomking Balerdroch". Furthermore, it does not matter if your opponent has already applied the effect of banishing from the Graveyard that turn.
Card or effect that includes an effect t.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Doomking Balerdroch", "Ghost Belle & Haunted Mansion"

Negate Effects.interaction: If a monster's effect increases ATK or DEF, and that effect can only be applied to that monster itself, the already-applied effect will cease to apply (returning the ATK to normal) if the monster's effects are negated[].
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
The first effect of "Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon" has resolved, and its own ATK has been increased by the destroyed monster's ATK. Afterwards, "Infinite Impermanence" resolves, negating "Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon"'s effects. What happens to the increased ATK?
Answer:
The ATK increase will cease to apply.
If a monster's effect increases ATK or DEF, and that effect can only be applied to that monster itself, the already-applied effect will cease to apply (returning the ATK to normal) if the monster's effects are negated.
The first effect of "Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon" is such an effect.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Infinite Impermanence", "Accesscode Talker"

Negate Effects.interaction: For monster effects that increase/decrease ATK/DEF, if the effect can be applied to monsters other than the activating monster itself, those effects remain applied even if the monster's effects are later negated[].
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
The first effect of "Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon" has resolved, changing both its own ATK and that of the targeted monster.
If "Infinite Impermanence" now resolves targeting that "Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon", negating its effects, what happens to the ATK of "Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon", and what happens to the ATK of the monster targeted by "Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon"'s effect?
Answer:
Both monster's ATK remains unchanged. (= Increased/decreased according to the effect.)
For monster effects that increase/decrease ATK/DEF, if the effect can be applied to monsters other than the activating monster itself, those effects remain applied even if the monster's effects are later negated. The first effect of "Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon", mentioned in this question, is such an effect.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Dark Rebellion Xyz Dragon", "Infinite Impermanence", "Eldlich the Golden Lord"

Cannot switch control/possession.interaction: Your opponent controls a monster (1) whose control/possession cannot switch. You cannot attach (1) to a monster you control (2) as material as it is considered changing control of that opponent's monster, therefore a card or effect that involves such action cannot be activated[].
Cannot switch control/possession.example:
Question:
My opponent controls an "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", and its "â— 10+" effect that prevents control of it from switching is being applied.
In this scenario, can I activate the effect of my "Cyber Dragon Infinity" that attaches the target to it as material by targeting that "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10"?
Answer:
No, you cannot. Attaching an opponent's monster to a monster you control as material is considered changing control of that opponent's monster.
Cannot switch control/possession.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", "Cyber Dragon Infinity"

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: If an effect (1) that involves attaching a card (2) as an Xyz Material to an Xyz Monster on the field (3) is activated, if (3) is flipped face-down by another card's effect, then (1) resolves still by attaching (2) to (3)[].
Change to face-down Defense Position.example:
Question:
If "Overlay Regen" is activated, but "Book of Moon" is chained so that the targeted Xyz Monster is in face-down Defense Position when "Overlay Regen" resolves, does its effect apply?
Answer:
At the time "Overlay Regen" resolves, even if the targeted Xyz Monster is now face-down, the effect of attaching "Overlay Regen" to it as an Xyz Material still applies as usual.
Change to face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Overlay Regen", "Book of Moon"

Unaffected.interaction: If an effect (1) that involves attaching a card (2) as an Xyz Material to an Xyz Monster on the field (3) is activated, if (3) is unaffected by cards' effects, then (1) resolves without attaching (2) to (3)[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
If "Overlay Regen" is activated, but "Forbidden Lance" is chained so that the targeted monster becomes unaffected by other Spell/Trap effects, how does "Overlay Regen" resolve? Also, if "Overlay Regen" is activated by targeting a monster that has already become unaffected by other Spell/Trap effects because of "Forbidden Lance", how does "Overlay Regen" resolve?
Answer:
In either case, it is not possible to attach "Overlay Regen" to the targeted monster as an Xyz Material, as it is unaffected by Spell effects. As a result, "Overlay Regen" is sent to the Graveyard.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attaching material affects the monster being attached to

Attack directly.interaction:
Monsters that can attack all opponent's monsters once and can attack directly[]:
  • After attacking your opponent directly, it is not possible to attack all monsters they control once each.
  • If you attacked an opponent's monster first, you cannot attack your opponent directly afterwards.
Attack directly.example:
Question:
If the effect of "Bujingi Ophidian" is applied to "Bujintei Susanowo", can "Bujintei Susanowo" attack both your opponent directly and all monsters they control once each?
Answer:
If the effect of "Bujingi Ophidian" is applied to "Bujintei Susanowo", after attacking your opponent directly, it is not possible to attack all monsters they control once each.
If you attacked an opponent's monster first, you cannot attack your opponent directly afterwards.
Attack directly.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters that can attack all opponent's monsters once each cannot attack the opponent directly afterwards and vice versa

Change attack target.interaction: If a monster (1) can attack all opponent's monsters once each, if it attacks a monster (2) but then its attack is redirected to another monster (3), (1) cannot attack again (2). Furthermore, (3) which has been made the attack target instead of (2), if (3) has not been destroyed by battle after the attack redirection, (1) cannot attack again (3)[].
Change attack target.example:
Question:
A "Number 39: Utopia" equipped with "ZW - Asura Strike" attacks an opponent's "Ruffian Railcar", but the opponent activates the effect of "Construction Train Signal Red" from their hand, and damage calculation is performed. After that battle is finished, can "Number 39: Utopia" attack either "Ruffian Railcar" or "Construction Train Signal Red"?
Answer:
In this case, since the effect of "Construction Train Signal Red" makes itself the attack target, it cannot be attacked again by "Number 39: Utopia" equipped with "ZW - Asura Strike". In addition, the "Ruffian Railcar" which was attacked when the opponent activated the effect of "Construction Train Signal Red" also cannot be attacked again.
Change attack target.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attack target redirection and effects that allow attacking all monsters, once each

Negate Effects.interaction:
A monster that can attack all opponent's monsters once each declares its second (or more) attack during the current Battle Phase (a continuous effect is applying). If its effects become negated[]:
  • If its effects are negated during the Battle Step, it will no longer be possible to continue that attack, or to make additional attacks.
  • If its effects are negated during the Damage Step (by "Forbidden Droplet" for example), damage calculation will be conducted for that attack normally.
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
I control "Mementoal Tecuhtlica - Combined Creation", whose "this card can attack all monsters your opponent controls, once each" effect is applying. I now declare its second (or more) attack during the current Battle Phase. In response to the attack declaration, or otherwise during the Battle Step, "Mementoal Tecuhtlica - Combined Creation"'s effects become negated. What happens to the ongoing attack??
Furthermore, what happens if, instead, "Mementoal Tecuhtlica - Combined Creation"'s effects become negated during the Damage Step, such as due to a card like "Forbidden Droplet"?
Answer:
If you declare a second etc. attack due to the effect of "Mementoal Tecuhtlica - Combined Creation", and its effects are negated during the Battle Step, it will no longer be possible to continue that attack, or to make additional attacks.
Furthermore, if the effects of "Mementoal Tecuhtlica - Combined Creation" which is attacking for the second (or more) time are negated during the Damage Step by "Forbidden Droplet", damage calculation will be conducted for that attack normally.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Multiple attacks, and the monster's effects being negated while attacking

Change battle position.interaction: Even if a monster (1) declares an attack while in face-up Defense Position, and the effect of a card (2) then changes (1) to Attack Position during the Battle Step, the attack will still continue as usual. However, as damage calculation is conducted while (1) is in face-up Attack Position, its DEF will not be used for damage calculation. Therefore, damage calculation is conducted as it would for any monster, using (1)'s current ATK[].
Change battle position.example:
Question:
A face-up Defense Position "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo", or a face-up Defense Position "Superheavy Samurai Ogre Shutendoji", declares an attack due to its effect. When it does, "Enemy Controller" is activated by targeting it.
This results in the battle position of "Superheavy Samurai Ogre Shutendoji" etc. being changed, so it is now in Attack Position. What happens to the attack?
Answer:
Even if "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo" etc. declares an attack while in face-up Defense Position, and the effect of "Enemy Controller" then changes it to Attack Position during the Battle Step, the attack will still continue as usual.
However, as damage calculation is conducted while "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo" etc. is in face-up Attack Position, its DEF will not be used for damage calculation. Therefore, damage calculation is conducted as it would for any monster, using "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo" etc.'s current ATK.
Change battle position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo", "Enemy Controller"

Negate Effects.interaction:
