A monster is in face-up Defense Position and its effect that allows it to attack while in face-up Defense Position is applying. If you declare an attack with it while the monster is in Defense Position and an effect that negates its effects is activated or applied[]:
  • If the monster's effects are negated during the Battle Step, it can no longer attack while being in face-up Defense Position. In this case, the attack stops without entering the Damage Step.
  • If the monster's effects are negated during the Damage Step, the Damage Step ends without conducting Damage Calculation.
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
"Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo" or "Superheavy Samurai Ogre Shutendoji" are in face-up Defense Position and their effect that allows them to attack while in face-up Defense Position applies. If I declare an attack using this effect and "Forbidden Chalice" is activated during the Battle Step and the effect is negated, what happens?
Also, what happens if "Forbidden Chalice" was activated during the Damage Step instead?
Answer:
When "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo" or "Superheavy Samurai Ogre Shutendoji" attack while being in face-up Defense Position by applying their own effect, and that effect gets negated during the Battle Step by "Forbidden Chalice", "Superheavy Samurai Warlord Susanowo" or "Superheavy Samurai Ogre Shutendoji" can no longer attack while being in face-up Defense Position. In this case, the attack stops without entering the Damage Step.
Also, if their effects get negated during the Damage Step, the Damage Step ends without conducting Damage Calculation.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Attacking in Defense Position, and negating the attacking monster's effects

Negate Activated Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that banish cards (2) is chained to banish (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be banished due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Negate Activated Effects.example:
Question:
I chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to change to face-down Defense Position. Is the effect of "Judgment Dragon" negated?
Also, if I activated "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Also, if I activated "Compulsory Evacuation Device" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Answer:
Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of "Forbidden Chalice" will not be applied once "Judgment Dragon" changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of "Book of Moon", so the effect of "Judgment Dragon" will not be negated, and all other cards on the field will be destroyed.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is returned to the hand by the effect of "Compulsory Evacuation Device" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Negate Activated Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Negate Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that banish cards (2) is chained to banish (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be banished due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
I chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to change to face-down Defense Position. Is the effect of "Judgment Dragon" negated?
Also, if I activated "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Also, if I activated "Compulsory Evacuation Device" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Answer:
Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of "Forbidden Chalice" will not be applied once "Judgment Dragon" changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of "Book of Moon", so the effect of "Judgment Dragon" will not be negated, and all other cards on the field will be destroyed.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is returned to the hand by the effect of "Compulsory Evacuation Device" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: Negating a card's activation (not effect's activation) removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field. A card that would be banished when it leaves the field, if it has its card activation negated, it is not banished and is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard normally[].
Negate Activation of Cards.example:
Question:
A "Super Soldier Shield" was set on the field by its own effect.
Afterwards, if that "Super Soldier Shield" is activated, and it has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit", is that "Super Soldier Shield" banished?
Answer:
In the proposed scenario, since the "Super Soldier Shield" that has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit" is not considered to leave the field, it is not banished and is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard normally.
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a card's activation removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: When monsters that have been banished temporarily are returned to the field, if their controller had changed by an effect, they are returned to the side of the field of the controller they had before being banished. Then, if the control of the monsters has been changed due to an effect that temporarily gains control of the monsters, control of the monsters returns to the original owner[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Interdimensional Matter Forwarder", "Number 11: Big Eye"

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: When monsters that have been banished temporarily are returned to the field, if their controller had changed by an effect, they are returned to the side of the field of the controller they had before being banished. Then, if the control of the monsters has been changed due to an effect that permanently gains control of the monsters, control of the monsters does not return to the original owner[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example:
Question:
I have gained control of a monster by one of the following effects. That monster is then banished, and returned to the field, by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Forwarder". What happens to the monster?
â’¶: the effect of "Number 11: Big Eye".
(i.e., an effect that lets me permanently gain control of the monster)
â’·: the effect of "Change of Heart"
(i.e., and effect that lets me temporarily gain control of the monster)
Answer:
â’¶: You retain control of the monster. For effects such as that of Big Eye, which do not have a time limit for which you gain control of the monster, control will not return to your opponent even if the card is banished temporarily.
â’·: Control of the monster immediately returns to your opponent. For effects such as that of "Change of Heart", which specify a time limit for which you gain control of the monster, the effect will end if the monster is temporarily banished. Therefore, when the monster returns to the Monster Zone, control immediately returns to the opponent.
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Interdimensional Matter Forwarder", "Number 11: Big Eye"

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: A Trap Treated as a Monster (not treated as a Trap) is being banished until the End Phase by a card effect. Once the Trap returns to the field to the Monster Zone during the End Phase, it will no longer be treated as a monster, and will immediately be sent to the Graveyard[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.example:
Question:
What happens if "S:P Little Knight"'s "banish both until the End Phase" effect resolves targeting both itself and one of the following?
â’¶: A Token
â’·: A monster that was originally a Trap Card, such as "Traptrix Holeutea"
â’¸: A Ritual, Fusion, Synchro, Xyz, or Link Monster that has not been properly Special Summoned
Answer:
â’¶: The targeted Token disappears, and "S:P Little Knight" is banished until the End Phase. (At that point, "S:P Little Knight" returns to the Monster Zone as usual.)
â’·: Both "S:P Little Knight" and "Traptrix Holeutea" are banished, and both return to the Monster Zone during the End Phase. At that point, "Traptrix Holeutea" is immediately sent to the Graveyard.
â’¸: Both monsters are banished, and both monsters return to the Monster Zone normally during the End Phase. (The monsters that return during the End Phase are not being Special Summoned.)
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "S:P Little Knight" more interactions

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: A Trap Treated as a Monster (strill treated as a Trap) is being banished until the End Phase by a card effect. Once the Trap returns to the field to the Monster Zone during the End Phase, it will no longer be treated as a monster, and will immediately be sent to the Graveyard[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Temporary banishment & Trap Monsters

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: You can take control of an opponent's monster that's the wrong Type/Attribute with a card like "Mind Control". If you do, it's sent to the Graveyard immediately after you gain control of it[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • Official KONAMI's FAQ of "Rivalry of Warlords" and "Gozen Match"

Immediately after this effect resolves,.interaction:
"There Can Be Only One" (1) is set on your opponent's field[].
  • You can activate an effect (2) as Chain Link 1 that summons back monsters (3) from a location (like the Graveyard) to the field and immediately after at resolution performs a Special Summon of a monster (4)
  • Your opponent chains as Chain Link 2 (1). The chain resolves backwards, and you have to summon monsters that don't violate (1), which means they have a different Type from the monsters you control. If you do not have any, (2) resolves without summoning anything.
  • When (3) are summoned back to the field, if two or more monsters in (3) have the same Type, due to (1) you have to keep monsters till you only control one of the same Type. If doing so the number of monsters summoned (3) changes and you cannot summon (4) anymore, then (2) resolves without performing the Special Summon.
Immediately after this effect resolves,.example:
Question:
The only monster in my Monster Zone is "Bujinki Ahashima". If I activate its effect that Special Summons 2 monsters with the same Level and performs an Xyz Summon, what happens if my opponent chains "There Can Be Only One"?
Answer:
In this scenario, the effect of "Bujinki Ahashima" will resolve while the effect of "There Can Be Only One" that allows each player to only control 1 monster of the same Type is applying.
Since "Bujinki Ahashima" is a Beast-Warrior monster, you cannot Special Summon any Beast-Warrior monsters from your hand or Graveyard with its effect. If you do not have any non-Beast-Warrior monsters in your hand or Graveyard to Special Summon, you cannot Special Summon any monsters.
If, for example, you Special Summon a Winged Beast-Type "Bujingi Crane" from your hand and a Beast-Type "Bujingi Turtle" from your Graveyard, you can then perform an Xyz Summon using those 2 monsters. However, if you choose 1 "Bujingi Crane" from your hand and 1 "Bujingi Crane" from your Graveyard, both are Special Summoned successfully, but the effect of "There Can Be Only One" will be applied, you must send 1 of the "Bujingi Crane"s to the Graveyard, and the Xyz Summon cannot be performed.
Immediately after this effect resolves,.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Floodgates & summon-immediately-after

Change Properties.interaction: A monster (1) with multiple attributes must be sent to the Graveyard while an "Gozen Match"'s activation resolves. Also, while (1) is not face-up on the field, its only attribute is the one listed on the card. Thus, you can still Normal, Flip or Special Summon (1) even if "Gozen Match"'s is applying. However, as soon as the effect of (1) is then applied, it must be sent to the Graveyard[].
Change Properties.example:
Question:
If the effect of "Gozen Match" applies, so that each player can only control monsters of 1 Attribute, will face-up monsters with multiple attributes, such as "Elemental Mistress Doriado", "Light and Darkness Dragon", or "Dark Simorgh", be sent to the Graveyard?
Furthermore, is it possible to Normal Summon, Flip Summon or Special Summon these monsters?
Answer:
If "Gozen Match"'s activation resolves while "Elemental Mistress Doriado", etc., are face-up, the "Elemental Mistress Doriado", etc., with multiple attributes must be sent to the Graveyard.
Also, while monsters such as "Elemental Mistress Doriado" are not face-up on the field, their only attribute is the one listed on the card. Thus, you can still Normal, Flip or Special Summon them even if "Gozen Match" is applying.
However, as soon as the effect of "Elemental Mistress Doriado", etc., is then applied, it must be sent to the Graveyard.
Change Properties.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Gozen Match", "Elemental Mistress Doriado"

If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.interaction: Optional substitution effects (1) cannot be applied to protect another card (2) if the substituting card itself (3) would also be destroyed at the point in time the substitution effect (1) applies. In which case both (2) and (3) will be destroyed. This is the case even if an effect that would prevent (3) from being destroyed once/next/first time per turn is applying: the substitution effect cannot be applied[].
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.example:
Question:
I control "Hugin the Runick Wings" and a Field Spell. "Runick Slumber"'s effect has been applied to "Hugin the Runick Wings", and as a result, "the next time [it] would be destroyed by battle or card effect this turn, it is not destroyed."
In this situation, "Black Rose Dragon"'s "destroy all cards on the field" effect now resolves. Can I apply "Hugin the Runick Wings"'s "if another card(s) you control would be destroyed by card effect, you can banish this card you control instead" effect?
Answer:
No, you cannot.
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Hugin the Runick Wings", "Runick Slumber"

Change Properties.interaction:
A card (1) with the restriction of "you cannot Normal or Special Summon except X monsters the turn you activate this card" is applying. Normally, if you Summon a monster (2) which violates the restriction of (1), then (1) cannot be activated. Similarly, if you activate (1) first (2) cannot be Summoned. But if[]:
  • A card (3) has an effect that applies to (2) such that when (2) is Summoned it does not violate the restriction of (1), then (1) can be activated after (2) has been Summoned.
  • A card (3) has an effect that applies to (2) such that when (2) is Summoned it does not violate the restriction of (1), but you have already activated (1) before (2) is Summoned, then (2) cannot be Summoned anymore.
Change Properties.example:
Question:
A "DNA Transplant" that was activated by declaring the LIGHT Attribute is face-up on the field. In this situation, I activate "Monster Reborn" and Special Summon "Darklord Superbia" from my Graveyard, then activate its effect and Special Summon "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra" from the Graveyard. During the same turn, can I activate the effect of "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra"?
Answer:
Even if you Special Summoned a "Darklord Superbia" (whose original Attribute is DARK) this turn, if you did so while the effect of "DNA Transplant" was applying declaring LIGHT, you can activate the effect of "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra".
However, if you first activated the effect of "Mozarta the Melodious Maestra", you cannot Special Summon monsters whose original Attributes are anything other than LIGHT, even if the effect of "DNA Transplant" is applying.
Change Properties.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Property changing and being treated as having Special Summoned monsters with a given property

Change Properties.interaction: An effect (1) is applying so that monsters with a certain specific property X cannot be summoned, but monsters with another specific property Y can be summoned. A monster (2)'s has X property, so (2) can't be summoned due to (1). If (2) has an effect that says "summon this card as a monster with Y property", then (2) can be summoned through that effect[].
Change Properties.example:
Question:
My opponent controls "Evilswarm Ophion", which has materials attached and is applying its effect.
Can I now Special Summon "Cockadoodledoo" using its "you can Special Summon this card (from your hand) as a Level 3 monster" effect?
Furthermore, can I Special Summon "Cockadoodledoo" using its "you can Special Summon this card (from your hand) as a Level 4 monster" effect?
Answer:
While the effect of "Evilswarm Ophion" is applying, Level 5 or higher monsters cannot be Special Summoned. Regardless, you can Special Summon "Cockadoodledoo" from your hand using either of the effects mentioned.
Change Properties.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Monsters being summoned "as a monster with Y property", and restrictions on summoning monsters with/without a specific property X

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: If the only monsters your opponent controls are monsters whose control/possession cannot switch, you cannot activate an effect that would take control of an opponent's monster[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example:
Question:
When my "Goyo King" destroys an opponent's monster by battle, I activate its effect and to take control of my opponent's monster. Can I choose a "Botanical Lion" as the monster to take control of?
Answer:
When resolving that effect of "Goyo King", you cannot choose a "Botanical Lion" whose effect is applying, as control of it cannot switch.
(As a result, if the only monster your opponent controls is that "Botanical Lion", you cannot activate the effect of "Goyo King" that takes control of your opponent's monster.)
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Activation legality for attempting to take control

Equipping Monsters.interaction: Your opponent controls a monster (1) whose control/possession cannot switch. You cannot equip (1) to a monster you control (2) as an equip card as it is considered changing control of that opponent's monster[].
Equipping Monsters.example:
Question:
My opponent controls an "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", and its "â— 10+" effect that prevents control of it from switching is being applied.
In this scenario, can I activate the effect of my "Relinquished" that equips the target to it by targeting that "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10"?
Answer:
No, you cannot. Causing an opponent's monster to become an Equip Card under your control is considered changing control of that opponent's monster.
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Armed Dragon Thunder LV10", "Relinquished"

Must attack.interaction: If you control a monster (1) that says "monsters your opponent controls that can attack must attack this card" and a card that prevents (1) from being targeted for attacks, your opponent's monsters must attack (1) due to its effect[].
Must attack.example:
Question:
If I control a "Puppet Rook", which is treated as a Fiend due to a card effect, and a "Labrynth Archfiend", how can my opponent's monsters attack?
Answer:
In this situation, your opponent's monsters must attack "Puppet Rook" due to its effect.
Must attack.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Must attack" & "cannot be targeted for attacks"

Unaffected.interaction: Preventing monsters from being targeted for an attack affects the monsters doing the attack targeting[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
You control a face-up "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" and a face-up "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin", and the opponent controls a "Skypalace Gangaridai" affected by the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora".
In this case, if the opponent's "Skypalace Gangaridai" attacks, can "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin" be targeted for an attack?
Answer:
The effect of "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" that prevents other "Ninja" Monsters you control from being targeted for attacks is an effect that affects the monsters performing attacks.
Therefore, in the proposed scenario, since "Skypalace Gangaridai" is not affected by the effects of other cards, "Twilight Ninja Nichirin, the Chunin" can be targeted for an attack.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Preventing monsters from being targeted for an attack affects the monsters doing the attack targeting

Unaffected.interaction: This is the case for both effects that say "monsters your opponent controls cannot target X for attacks" like "Twilight Ninja Shingetsu" and effects that say "your opponent cannot target X for attacks" like "The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode": a monster unaffected by those cards can still target them for attacks[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode"

Unaffected.interaction: If you are not applying an effect to the monster, preventing a monster from being targeted does not affect the monster[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
I control "Ancient Gear Fortress", and a "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" which I Fusion Summoned this turn. "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant"'s "unaffected by Spell/Trap effects" effect is applying. What happens to "Ancient Gear Fortress"'s "during the turn they were Normal or Special Summoned, your opponent cannot target "Ancient Gear" monsters you control with card effects, and they cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects" effect?
Answer:
Since "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" is unaffected by Spell effects, the "they cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects" effect of "Ancient Gear Fortress" does not apply to it. (For example, it could be destroyed by your opponent's monster effects.)
However, the "your opponent cannot target "Ancient Gear" monsters you control with card effects" effect of "Ancient Gear Fortress" does not affect monsters. Therefore, your opponent will still be unable to target "Chaos Ancient Gear Giant" with card effects this turn.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Preventing a monster from being targeted does not affect the monster (Unless you are applying an effect to the monster)

During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.interaction: Effects that resolve [A] later during [X] (during the End Phase for example) are still "effects that include an effect that does [A]"[].
During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.example:
Question:
When my opponent Special Summons a monster due to "Spellbook of Judgment", can I activate "Solemn Warning", "Black Horn of Heaven", "Royal Oppression", or similar?
Answer:
The Special Summon of a monster when resolving "Spellbook of Judgment" during the End Phase does not start a chain. However, as it is a Special Summon of a monster due to the effect of "Spellbook of Judgment", this Special Summon cannot be negated by activating "Solemn Warning", "Black Horn of Heaven", "Royal Oppression", or similar.
However, "Solemn Warning" and "Royal Oppression" can be activated in response to the card activation of "Spellbook of Judgment".
During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating delayed Special Summons

Effect becomes [A] - Changing/overwritin.interaction: A card (1) that changes/overwrites an effect (2) so that (2) does [A] instead does not make (1) a card or effect "that includes an effect that does [A]"[].
Effect becomes [A] - Changing/overwritin.example:
Question:
When my opponent activates the effect of "Generaider Boss Stage" that Special Summons a "Generaider" monster from their Deck, I chain "Mystical Space Typhoon" and target "Generaider Boss Stage". Then, if my opponent chains the effect of "Generaider Boss Room", can I further chain the effect of "Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring"?
Answer:
When your opponent activates the effect of "Generaider Boss Room", you cannot chain the effect of "Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring".
Effect becomes [A] - Changing/overwritin.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Generaider Boss Room", "Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring"

Immediately after this effect resolves,.interaction: The activation of a card or of an effect that "Immediately after this effect resolves, [method] Summon [X]" are "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)"[].
Immediately after this effect resolves,.example:
Question:
Can I chain the effect of "Tearlaments Rulkallos", which can respond to any effect's activation if it "includes an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)," to the activation of "I:P Masquerena"'s "Link Summon 1 Link Monster" effect?
Answer:
Yes, you can.
(The activation of "I:P Masquerena"'s effect is considered to "include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)." )
Immediately after this effect resolves,.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Special Summons caused by a card effect, and whether the effect includes Special Summoning

Copy effect resolves as another card's e.interaction: A card or effect (1) that copies a card's effect (2) that does [A] does not make (1) a card or effect "that includes an effect that does [A]"[].
Copy effect resolves as another card's e.example:
Question:
When the "You can pay 2000 Life Points and send 1 "Fusion" or ""Polymerization"" Normal or Quick-Play Spell from your Deck to the Graveyard; this effect becomes that Spell's effect when that card is activated, also, you cannot Special Summon monsters for the rest of this turn." effect of "Predaplant Verte Anaconda" is activated, will the "The activation of your cards and effects that include an effect that Fusion Summons a Fusion Monster cannot be negated, also your opponent's cards and effects cannot activate when a monster is Fusion Summoned this way." effect of "Magical Meltdown" be applied?
Answer:
No, it will not be applied.
Even if the effect of "Predaplant Verte Anaconda" results in a Fusion Summon being performed, it is not treated as an effect that "includes an effect that Fusion Summons a Fusion Monster," so the effect of "Magical Meltdown", "Dragonroid" or "Branded Lost" will not be applied.
As an example, if the opponent activates "Solemn Strike" in response to the activation of the effect of "Predaplant Verte Anaconda", its activation will be negated.
If the Fusion Summon performed is successful, the opponent can still respond with cards and effects.
Copy effect resolves as another card's e.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Predaplant Verte Anaconda", "Magical Meltdown", "Fusion Duplication", "Transaction Rollback"

During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.interaction: Effects that resolve [A] later during [X] (during the End Phase for example) are not "effects that would do [A]". Also, since the application of the effect during the [X] Phase does not create a chain, the effect of cards that chain to "Card or effect that would do [A]" cannot be activated at that time[].
During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.example:
Question:
Can the activation of the effect of "Prediction Princess Astromorrigan" be negated by "Stardust Dragon"?
Answer:
The effect of "Stardust Dragon" cannot be chained to that of "Prediction Princess Astromorrigan". Also, since the application of the effect during the End Phase does not create a chain, the effect of "Stardust Dragon" cannot be activated at that time.
During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Prediction Princess Astromorrigan", "Stardust Dragon"

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: A card or effect that negates the activation of a Spell/Trap Card is not considered to be an effect that "would destroy a card(s) on the field"[].
Negate Activation of Cards.example:
Question:
I activate a Spell Card from my hand. If my opponent chains the effect of "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV8", can I activate the effect of "Stardust Dragon" to negate the activation of "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV8"'s effect?
Furthermore, if the Spell Card was instead previously Set face-down on the field, can the effect of "Stardust Dragon" be activated in that scenario?
Answer:
The effect of "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV8" that negates the activation of a Spell Card is not considered to be an effect that destroys cards on the field.
Therefore, it is not possible to activate the effect of "Stardust Dragon" in either of the scenarios given.
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV8", "Stardust Dragon"

Copy effect resolves as another card's e.interaction: An effect that copies a card's effect that does [A] is not treated as an "effects that would do [A]"[].
Copy effect resolves as another card's e.example:
Question:
If the effect of "Traptrix Rafflesia" that makes its effect become the same as a "Hole" Normal Trap Card is activated, can the effect of "Stardust Dragon" be chained to it?
Answer:
The effect of "Traptrix Rafflesia" is not treated as an effect that destroys cards on the field when it is activated. Even if "Trap Hole" or "Bottomless Trap Hole" are sent to the Graveyard when their activation requirements are met, it is not possible to chain the effect of "Stardust Dragon".
Copy effect resolves as another card's e.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Traptrix Rafflesia", "Stardust Dragon"

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: If the control of a monster (1) has been changed due to an effect that temporarily gains control of it, and (1) is later flipped face-down by another effect, control of (1) will still return to the original owner[].
Change to face-down Defense Position.example:
Question:
I gained control over an opponent's face-up monster due to the effect of "Mind Control".
Afterwards, if that monster is changed to face-down Defense Position, what happens to the effect (of "Mind Control") that has been applied to it?
Answer:
The "take control of that target" part of the effect will still be applied until the End Phase, but the "it cannot declare an attack or be Tributed" part of the effect will no longer be applied.
(It will remain under your control until the End Phase, but it can be Tributed and if it is changed to Attack Position, it can attack.)
Furthermore, if "Mind Control" was initially used to gain control of an opponent's face-down Defense Position monster, the "it cannot declare an attack or be Tributed" part of the effect will still be applied. (Even if that monster later becomes face-up, it cannot attack or be Tributed while it remains face-up in the Monster Zone during that turn.)
Change to face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Mind Control"

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: The control of a monster (1) has been changed due to a face-up card (2) that targeted (1) and is applying a continuous effect on the field. If (1) is later flipped face-down by another effect, (2) stops targeting (1) and therefore control of the monster returns to the original owner[].
Change to face-down Defense Position.example:
Question:
If a monster equipped with "Graydle Alligator", "Graydle Cobra" or "Graydle Eagle" is changed to face-down Defense Position, what happens to the "While this card is equipped to a monster by this effect, take control of that monster. When this card leaves the field, destroy the equipped monster." effect that is applied?
Answer:
Since that monster cannot be equipped with Equip Cards anymore, "Graydle Alligator" (etc.) is destroyed. In that case, since at that time the monster is no longer being targeted by "Graydle Alligator" (etc.), the monster is not destroyed by the "when this card leaves the field, destroy the equipped monster" effect.
Also, "take control of that monster" stops applying, and control of it returns to your opponent.
Change to face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Graydle Alligator", "Snatch Steal"

Change to face-down Defense Position.interaction: Another example being "Crackdown": the control of the targeted monster returns to the original owner if that monster is flipped face-down[].
Change to face-down Defense Position.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Crackdown"

If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle.interaction: If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys an opponent's monster by battle and sends it to the GY: do [A]", even if [X] destroys a monster that you originally owned, [A] can still be activated[].
If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle.example:
Question:
My opponent controls a Normal Monster in their Monster Zone, which was originally owned by me.
If I attack this monster with my "Goyo Guardian", and destroy it by battle, can I activate "Goyo Guardian"'s "Special Summon that monster to your field in Defense Position" effect?
Answer:
Yes, you can. (When it resolves, the monster is Special Summoned from your Graveyard to your Main Monster Zone in Defense Position.)
If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Goyo Guardian", "Ancient Warriors - Ambitious Cao De"

Send to the Graveyard as an effect.interaction: If control of a card changes and it is sent to the Graveyard by the resolution of a card effect, that card is sent to the owner's Graveyard[].

End the Battle Phase.interaction: If your opponent attacks and an effect (1) that "changes attack target and performs damage calculation" is activated, then you chain an effect (2) that ends the Battle Phase, due to the effect of (2) resolving, the effect of (1) resolves during the End Step of the Battle Phase. Because the attack is completed, you do not perform damage calculation[].
End the Battle Phase.example:
Question:
During my opponent's turn, if my opponent attacks my "Decoy Dragon" and its effect is activated, and I chain the effect of "Electromagnetic Turtle", how does each effect resolve?
Answer:
In this case, due to the effect of "Electromagnetic Turtle" resolving, the effect of "Decoy Dragon" resolves during the End Step of the Battle Phase. The targeted Dragon-Type monster is still Special Summoned from your Graveyard, but because the attack is completed, you do not perform damage calculation.
End the Battle Phase.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Decoy Dragon", "Electromagnetic Turtle"

Unaffected.interaction: Changing the attack target affects the monster[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
When my opponent's "Tatsunoko" attacks directly, I activate the effect of a "Dark Spirit of Banishment" in my hand at the start of the Damage Step, targeting a "Curse Necrofear" in my Graveyard. In this case, how does the effect resolve?
Answer:
In this scenario, since your opponent's "Tatsunoko" is unaffected by monster effects, it is unaffected by the effect of "Dark Spirit of Banishment" that changes its attack target and performs damage calculation. Although "Curse Necrofear" is still Special Summoned by the effect of "Dark Spirit of Banishment", it does not become the new attack target, so "Tatsunoko" continues its attack normally as a direct attack.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Changing the attack target affects the monster

Equipping Monsters.interaction: A monster (1) has an effect that equips another monster (2) on the field to itself. If (2) is flipped to face-down Defense Position at the time of the resolution of (1)'s effect, (2) will still be equipped to (1), unless the effect requires the targets to still meet the target requirements at resolution to be affected[].
Equipping Monsters.example:
Question:
If "Book of Moon" is chained to the effect of "Vampire Vamp" that equips it with a monster the opponent controls, so that at the time of the resolution the targeted monster has been flipped to face-down Defense Position, how does the effect resolve?
Answer:
Even in that case, the monster targeted by the effect of "Vampire Vamp" is still equipped.
In that case, since that monster is equipped while remaining face-down, there is no ATK increase by the effect of "Vampire Vamp" that increases its own ATK by the original ATK of the equipped monster.
Equipping Monsters.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Book of Moon", "Vampire Vamp"

Negate Activation of Effects.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that negates the activation of the effects (2) is chained to negate the activations of the effects of (1). Then an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (3) is chained to flip (1). The the Chain resolves in reverse order and (1) will still negate the (2)'s effects activation[].
Negate Activation of Effects.example:
Question:
When I Tribute Summon "Mobius the Frost Monarch", I activate its effect. However, my opponent activates the effect of "Stardust Dragon" in response. If I now further activate "Book of Moon" by targeting my "Mobius the Frost Monarch", this chain resolves backwards, and causes "Mobius the Frost Monarch" to be face-down by the time "Stardust Dragon"'s effect resolves.
In this situation, will the effect of "Stardust Dragon" still negate the activation of "Mobius the Frost Monarch"'s effect, and destroy it?
Answer:
Even if "Mobius the Frost Monarch" is changed to face-down Defense Position by "Book of Moon", the effect of "Stardust Dragon" will still negate the activation of "Mobius the Frost Monarch"'s effect, and destroy "Mobius the Frost Monarch".
Negate Activation of Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating the activation of a monster's activated effect while it is face-down

Negate Activated Effects.interaction: Consider effects that say "when an effect is activated: [cost]; negate the/that effect" (negating activated effect) like "Ash Blossom & Joyous Spring". A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that negates monster's activated effects (2) is chained to negate the activated effects of (1). Then an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (3) is chained to flip (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, (1) changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of (2), and the effects of (1) will still be negated[]
Negate Activated Effects.example:
Question:
When my Level 5 or higher monster activates its effect, "Xyz Wrath" is activated in response. What happens if "Book of Moon" is then activated in response to "Xyz Wrath", causing the Level 5 or higher monster to be in face-down Defense Position by the time "Xyz Wrath" resolves?
Answer:
Even if the Level 5 or higher monster that activated its effect is in face-down Defense Position by the time "Xyz Wrath" resolves, the effect of "Xyz Wrath" will be applied normally. (The activated effect is negated, and the monster is destroyed.)
Negate Activated Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a monster's activated effect while it is face-down

Negate Effects.interaction: Consider effects that negate effects but not the activated effects like "Forbidden Chalice". A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that flips monsters to face-down Defense Position (2) is chained to flip (1). Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of (3) will not be applied once (1) changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of (2), so the effect of (1) will not be negated[].
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
I chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to change to face-down Defense Position. Is the effect of "Judgment Dragon" negated?
Also, if I activated "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Also, if I activated "Compulsory Evacuation Device" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Answer:
Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of "Forbidden Chalice" will not be applied once "Judgment Dragon" changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of "Book of Moon", so the effect of "Judgment Dragon" will not be negated, and all other cards on the field will be destroyed.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is returned to the hand by the effect of "Compulsory Evacuation Device" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Even if a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card which says it is not treated as a Trap Card is flipped face-down by the effect of "Book of Moon" or something similar, it is flipped face-down in the Main Monster Zone. If it is flipped face-up again, it is treated as a Monster according to what its text indicates[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: If a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card by its own effect is flipped face-down by an effect, it is placed face-down in the Spell & Trap Zone. It can be activated in the next turn and become a Monster Card once again[].
Changing from Monster Trap to Trap, it does not create a new copy[]
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
Question:
If the second effect of "Galaxy Cyclone" is activated by targeting an "Embodiment of Apophis" treated as a monster, and then "Book of Moon" is chained so that "Embodiment of Apophis" is Set, will it still be destroyed?
Answer:
Even in this case, the targeted card is destroyed normally.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Changing from Monster+Trap to Trap does not create a new copy

If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.interaction: Substituting for continuous attempts to destroy can be attempted, though futile[].
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.example:
Question:
If "Toon Kingdom" is face-up on my side of the field, and I activate "Comic Hand" by targeting an opponent's "Spirit Reaper", how will the effects apply?
Answer:
When "Comic Hand" resolves, you take control of the "Spirit Reaper" that was targeted, and it will be treated as a Toon monster.
After you gain control of "Spirit Reaper", its effect that destroys it when it is targeted by a card or effect will apply. In this case, you can apply the last effect of "Toon Kingdom" once, and banish the top card of your Deck face-down, but the effect of "Spirit Reaper" will immediately apply again, resulting in "Spirit Reaper" being destroyed.
If [X] would be destroyed, you can do [A.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Substituting for continuous attempts to destroy can be attempted, though futile

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: A Trap Card treated as a Monster Card by its own effect is treated as a Trap Card (written on the card's text) and a Monster Card. As a result, it can be destroyed by cards that destroy monsters and cards that destroy Spells or Traps[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Trap Cards treated as Monster Cards which say they are not treated as a Trap Card, like "The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine", are only treated as Monster Cards. As a result, they cannot be destroyed by effects that destroy Spell or Trap Cards[].

Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.interaction: Cards that are drawn are treated as being added to the hand[].
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.example:
Question:
"R-Genex Accelerator" was face-up on my field when I performed my normal draw for the Draw Phase. If the card I draw is a "Genex" monster, can I activate the effect of "R-Genex Accelerator" to Special Summon that monster from my hand?
Answer:
Even if a "Genex" monster is added to your hand by drawing, it is considered to have been added from your Deck to your hand. Therefore, in this scenario, you can activate the effect of "R-Genex Accelerator".
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "R-Genex Accelerator"

Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.interaction: If cards from the Deck are added to the hand by an effect that does not draw cards but "adds them to the hand", this is not treated as drawing cards[].
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.example: If a card is added to the hand by the effect of "Pot of Duality" that says "Excavate the top 3 cards of your Deck, add 1 of them to your hand, also, after that, shuffle the rest back into your Deck.", this is not treated as drawing cards.

Negate Summons.interaction:
The Special Summon of a monster when resolving an effect that happens later (during the End Phase for example) does not start a chain such as "Spellbook of Judgment".
  • As it is a Special Summon of a monster due an effect, this Special Summon cannot be negated by activating effects that negate summons like "Black Horn of Heaven"[].
  • However, it is still an "effects that include an effect that Special Summons a monster(s)", so cards like "Solemn Warning" can be activated in response[].
Negate Summons.example:
Question:
When my opponent Special Summons a monster due to "Spellbook of Judgment", can I activate "Solemn Warning", "Black Horn of Heaven", "Royal Oppression", or similar?
Answer:
The Special Summon of a monster when resolving "Spellbook of Judgment" during the End Phase does not start a chain. However, as it is a Special Summon of a monster due to the effect of "Spellbook of Judgment", this Special Summon cannot be negated by activating "Solemn Warning", "Black Horn of Heaven", "Royal Oppression", or similar.
However, "Solemn Warning" and "Royal Oppression" can be activated in response to the card activation of "Spellbook of Judgment".
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating delayed Special Summons

Unaffected by activated effects.interaction: Effects that apply later (delayed effects) also applies after the Chain Link formed by their activation has finished resolving. Therefore, they can also affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects"[].
Unaffected by activated effects.example:
Question:
My opponent controls a "Cyberdark End Dragon", which is "unaffected by your opponent's (= my) activated effects".
What happens if the effects of "Skill Drain", "Crackdown", or "Dimensional Barrier", or "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect, are applied in this situation?
Answer:
The effects of "Skill Drain" and "Dimensional Barrier" will negate the effects of "Cyberdark End Dragon", and the effect of "Crackdown" will take control of "Cyberdark End Dragon". "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect will destroy "Cyberdark End Dragon" during the End Phase.
Monsters which are "unaffected by activated effects" will be unaffected by any effect that is applied when the Chain Link formed by an activation resolves. However, any other effect will apply to them normally.
On the other hand, while the effects of "Skill Drain", "Crackdown", and "Dimensional Barrier" respectively are effects that begin applying when the Chain Link formed by the card activation resolves, these effects will continue to apply to monsters afterwards. Therefore, these effects can affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects".
Similarly, "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s "destroy all monsters your opponent controls during the End Phase of this turn" effect also applies after the Chain Link formed by its activation has finished resolving. Therefore, it can also affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects".
Unaffected by activated effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Unaffected by activated effects" and what it means

Unaffected.interaction: Changing/overwriting an effect so that it does [A] instead does not affect monsters.
Unaffected.example: The effect of "Phantom of Yubel" does not affect monsters. Even if the effect it is responding to is the effect of a monster that is unaffected by monster effects, that effect still becomes "your opponent destroys 1 "Yubel" monster in their hand, Deck, or field".
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Phantom of Yubel"

Negate Effects.interaction: If a monster (1)'s effect equips itself with any other non-Equip-Spell card, and (1)'s effect can only equip cards to the activating (1) itself, and (1)'s effects are then negated after it is equipped, the equipped card cannot remain equipped, and is destroyed as a result. It is not treated as being destroyed by a card effect[].
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
A "Therion "King" Regulus", which was equipped with a "Therion "Lily" Borea" due to its own effect, is in my Monster Zone. If the monster effects of that "Therion "King" Regulus" are now negated, for example due to "Skill Drain"'s effect, what happens to the effect that "Therion "King" Regulus" gained by equipped "Therion "Lily" Borea"?
Answer:
If the effects of "Therion "King" Regulus" are negated, such as because "Skill Drain"'s effect has applied to it, it can no longer continue to have monsters equipped to it by that effect. Therefore, the equipped "Therion "Lily" Borea" will be destroyed, and "Therion "King" Regulus" will no longer be gaining its effects.
(If a monster's effect equips itself with any other non-Equip-Spell card, and that monster effect can only equip cards to the activating monster itself, and that monster's effects are then negated after it is equipped, the equipped card cannot remain equipped, and is destroyed as a result. It is not treated as being destroyed by a card effect.)
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Therion "King" Regulus", "Skill Drain"

Negate Effects.interaction: If the effects of an Equip Card equipped to a monster are negated, the effects are negated but it remains on the field equipped to the equipped monster[].
Negate Effects.example: While the Union monster "Armored Cybern" is equipped to a monster, if the effect of "Silent Swordsman LV7" that says "Negate all Spell effects on the field." is applied, the effects of "Armored Cybern" are negated but it stays equipped to the equipped monster.

Unaffected.interaction: Even if a monster (1) is unaffected by card effects, the effect of a card that equips a card (2) to (1) will apply normally[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
If I activate the effect of "Dragunity Divine Lance", but "Forbidden Lance" is chained to make the equipped monster unaffected by Spell effects, what happens?
Answer:
Even if the monster equipped with "Dragunity Divine Lance" is unaffected by Spell effects, such as in the situation given, the effect of "Dragunity Divine Lance" will apply normally, and a "Dragunity" Tuner will be equipped from your Deck.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Dragunity Divine Lance", "Forbidden Lance"

Leaves the field.interaction: A monster on the field becoming an Equip Spell is not treated as the monster "leaving the field"[].
Leaves the field.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Relay Soul" and monster moved to Spell & Trap Zone

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: If your opponent fails to equip a monster you control to a monster your opponent's controls, this is not treated as "leaving the field because of your opponent's card"[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.example:
Question:
My opponent activates the effect of their "Relinquished Anima", targeting my Fusion Summoned "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon". In response, I activate the effect of "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon", which banishes a monster on the field.
When this chain resolves, I banish "Relinquished Anima" using the effect of "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon". Therefore, "Relinquished Anima" no longer exists on the field when its effect resolves, and "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" is sent to the Graveyard instead of becoming an Equip Card.
Can the effect of "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon", which can be activated if it is sent to the Graveyard by my opponent, now be activated?
Answer:
In the situation you describe, "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" is not treated as being sent to the Graveyard by your opponent. Therefore, that effect of "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon" cannot be activated.
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Leaves the field by your opponent" and failing to equip

Negate Effects.interaction: If a monster (1)'s effect equips itself with any other non-Equip-Spell card, and (1)'s effect can only equip cards to the activating (1) itself, and (1)'s effects are then negated after it is equipped, the equipped card cannot remain equipped, and is destroyed as a result. It is not treated as being destroyed by a card effect[].
Negate Effects.example:
Question:
A "Therion "King" Regulus", which was equipped with a "Therion "Lily" Borea" due to its own effect, is in my Monster Zone. If the monster effects of that "Therion "King" Regulus" are now negated, for example due to "Skill Drain"'s effect, what happens to the effect that "Therion "King" Regulus" gained by equipped "Therion "Lily" Borea"?
Answer:
If the effects of "Therion "King" Regulus" are negated, such as because "Skill Drain"'s effect has applied to it, it can no longer continue to have monsters equipped to it by that effect. Therefore, the equipped "Therion "Lily" Borea" will be destroyed, and "Therion "King" Regulus" will no longer be gaining its effects.
(If a monster's effect equips itself with any other non-Equip-Spell card, and that monster effect can only equip cards to the activating monster itself, and that monster's effects are then negated after it is equipped, the equipped card cannot remain equipped, and is destroyed as a result. It is not treated as being destroyed by a card effect.)
Negate Effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Therion "King" Regulus", "Skill Drain"

Negate Effects.interaction: If the effects of an Equip Card equipped to a monster are negated, the effects are negated but it remains on the field equipped to the equipped monster[].
Negate Effects.example: While the Union monster "Armored Cybern" is equipped to a monster, if the effect of "Silent Swordsman LV7" that says "Negate all Spell effects on the field." is applied, the effects of "Armored Cybern" are negated but it stays equipped to the equipped monster.

Change Properties.interaction: If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster [Y] with certain property Z by battle: do [A]", even if [X] destroys [Y] which had property Z on the field due to another card effect but after being destroyed and sent to the Graveyard [Y] has no longer property Z, [A] can still be activated[].
Change Properties.example:
Question:
If "Brain Golem" destroys a monster that is treated as LIGHT Attribute due to an effect like "Scroll of Bewitchment", will its effect to attack again activate?
Answer:
The effect of "Brain Golem" will activate at the End of the Damage Step, if the Attribute of the monster to be destroyed by the battle is LIGHT.
Therefore, even if the destroyed monster's Attribute is treated as LIGHT due to the effect of "Scroll of Bewitchment", that effect of "Brain Golem" will activate at the End of the Damage Step.
As a result, even if the Attribute of the monster after being destroyed and sent to the Graveyard is no longer LIGHT, "Brain Golem" can still attack again.
Change Properties.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Brain Golem", "Scroll of Bewitchment"

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle: do [A]", if [X] destroys a trap treated as a monster then [A] can be activated[]. Exceptions below.
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.example:
Question:
If "Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity" destroys an opponent's "Embodiment of Apophis" treated as a monster by battle, will its "inflict damage to your opponent equal to that monster's original ATK" effect activate?
Answer:
Since the activation condition of "this card destroying a monster by battle" was still met, the effect will still be activated. When it resolves, it will inflict 1600 damage, which is "Embodiment of Apophis"' original ATK.
The same also applies to the following cards' effects, which can/will still be activated even if the destroyed monster was originally a Trap Card (that was Special Summoned as a monster), and will inflict damage equal to that monster's original ATK respectively DEF: "Genex Ally Triforce", "Enlightenment Paladin", "Ruin, Supreme Queen of Oblivion", "Despian Proskenion", "Magikey Deity - Ashtartu", and "Elemental HERO Shining Neos Wingman".
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity", "Embodiment of Apophis"

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction:
If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle: do [A]", where [A] involves:
  • Equipping the destroyed monster to a monster on the field.
  • Attaching the destroyed monster to a monster on the field.
If/When [X] destroys a trap treated as a monster then [A] cannot be activated[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.example:
Question:
My opponent's "The Phantom Knights of Tomb Shield", which was Special Summoned as a monster by its "Special Summon this card in Attack Position as a Normal Monster" effect, is destroyed by battle with my "Predaplant Moray Nepenthes".
Can I now activate "Predaplant Moray Nepenthes"' "equip that monster to this card" effect?
Answer:
No, you cannot. (Since the destroyed "The Phantom Knights of Tomb Shield" is no longer treated as a monster after it leaves the Monster Zone, the "equip that monster to this card" effect cannot be applied.)
Furthermore, the same also applies to the following effects, which cannot be activated if a Trap that has been Special Summoned as a monster is destroyed by battle: "Infinitrack Earth Slicer"'s second effect, "Infinitrack Mountain Smasher"'s second effect, and "Infinitrack River Stormer"'s second effect.
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Predaplant Moray Nepenthes", "The Phantom Knights of Tomb Shield", "Infinitrack Earth Slicer"

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle and sends it to the GY: do [A]", if [X] destroys a trap treated as a monster then [A] cannot be activated as it is not a monster anymore in the Graveyard[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.example:
Question:
My opponent's "The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine", which was Special Summoned as a monster by its "Special Summon this card in Defense Position as a Normal Monster" effect, is destroyed by battle with my "Digital Bug Scaradiator".
Can I now activate "Digital Bug Scaradiator"'s "attach that destroyed monster to this card as material" effect?
Answer:
No, you cannot.
Effects with the "destroys a monster by battle and sends it to the Graveyard" activation condition can only be activated if the opponent's monster, which was destroyed by the battle, was sent to the Graveyard as a result, and is still a monster while in the Graveyard.
In the scenario you describe, the "The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine" that was destroyed is not treated as a monster while in the Graveyard. Therefore, the activation requirements for "Digital Bug Scaradiator"'s effect are not met.
Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Digital Bug Scaradiator", "The Phantom Knights of Shade Brigandine"

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle: do [A]", if [X] destroys a trap treated as a monster then [A] can be activated[]. Exceptions below.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
Question:
If "Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity" destroys an opponent's "Embodiment of Apophis" treated as a monster by battle, will its "inflict damage to your opponent equal to that monster's original ATK" effect activate?
Answer:
Since the activation condition of "this card destroying a monster by battle" was still met, the effect will still be activated. When it resolves, it will inflict 1600 damage, which is "Embodiment of Apophis"' original ATK.
The same also applies to the following cards' effects, which can/will still be activated even if the destroyed monster was originally a Trap Card (that was Special Summoned as a monster), and will inflict damage equal to that monster's original ATK respectively DEF: "Genex Ally Triforce", "Enlightenment Paladin", "Ruin, Supreme Queen of Oblivion", "Despian Proskenion", "Magikey Deity - Ashtartu", and "Elemental HERO Shining Neos Wingman".
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Hot Red Dragon Archfiend King Calamity", "Embodiment of Apophis"

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction:
If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle: do [A]", where [A] involves:
  • Equipping the destroyed monster to a monster on the field.
  • Attaching the destroyed monster to a monster on the field.
If/When [X] destroys a trap treated as a monster then [A] cannot be activated[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
Question:
My opponent's "The Phantom Knights of Tomb Shield", which was Special Summoned as a monster by its "Special Summon this card in Attack Position as a Normal Monster" effect, is destroyed by battle with my "Predaplant Moray Nepenthes".
Can I now activate "Predaplant Moray Nepenthes"' "equip that monster to this card" effect?
Answer:
No, you cannot. (Since the destroyed "The Phantom Knights of Tomb Shield" is no longer treated as a monster after it leaves the Monster Zone, the "equip that monster to this card" effect cannot be applied.)
Furthermore, the same also applies to the following effects, which cannot be activated if a Trap that has been Special Summoned as a monster is destroyed by battle: "Infinitrack Earth Slicer"'s second effect, "Infinitrack Mountain Smasher"'s second effect, and "Infinitrack River Stormer"'s second effect.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Predaplant Moray Nepenthes", "The Phantom Knights of Tomb Shield", "Infinitrack Earth Slicer"

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction: If an effect (1) reads "If/When [X] destroys a monster by battle and sends it to the GY: do [A]", if [X] destroys a trap treated as a monster then [A] cannot be activated as it is not a monster anymore in the Graveyard[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
Question:
When "Heroic Challenger - War Hammer" destroys an "Embodiment of Apophis" or "Tiki Soul" that are treated as monsters by battle and sends them to the Graveyard, can its effect to equip the destroyed monster to itself be activated? Also, if "Heroic Challenger - War Hammer" destroys a Spell/Trap Card treated as a monster by the effect of "Magical Hats" by battle and sends it to the Graveyard, can its effect to equip the destroyed monster be activated?
Answer:
The effect of "Heroic Challenger - War Hammer" cannot be activated if it destroys an "Embodiment of Apophis" treated as a monster by its own effect, or another Spell/Trap treated as a monster by the effects of "Magical Hats", by battle.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Heroic Challenger - War Hammer", "Embodiment of Apophis", "Tiki Soul", "Magical Hats"

Unaffected.interaction: Substitution does not affect the protected monster, and a monster unaffected by card effects can be protected by destruction substitution[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
If my "Horus the Black Flame Dragon LV6", which is unaffected by Spell effects due to its own effect, would be destroyed by battle or card effect, can I apply the effect of "Return of the Dragon Lords" in my Graveyard, or the effect of a "Therion Discolosseum" on my field?
Answer:
Yes, you can.
(Effects such as those of "Return of the Dragon Lords" or "Therion Discolosseum", which perform different actions instead of a card being destroyed, are not treated as effects that affect the card that would originally have been destroyed.)
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Substitution does not affect the protected monster

Leaves the field because of an opponent'.interaction: Monsters used as materials in this way do not "leave the field by a card effect"[].
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.example:
Question:
My opponent resolved the effect of their "Unchained Soul of Disaster" by targeting my "Sky Striker Ace - Kagari", Link Summoning "Unchained Soul of Rage" using both of these monsters.
Can I now activate the effect of a "Sky Striker Ace - Raye" in my Graveyard?
Answer:
No, you cannot.
The effect of "Unchained Soul of Disaster" allows your opponent to Link Summon using the targeted monster as material. As a result of your opponent Link Summoning, the targeted monster then leaves the field. The monster is not considered to have left the field due to your opponent's card effect.
Leaves the field because of an opponent'.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Unchained Soul of Disaster", "Sky Striker Ace - Raye"

Negate Summons.interaction: The monster summoned by an effect that says "Immediately after this effect resolves, [method] Summon [X]" can be negated if that effect was activated as Chain Link 1[].
Negate Summons.example:
Question:
The "immediately after this effect resolves, Synchro Summon using this card you control" effect of "Tenpai Dragon Chundra" resolves. When the Synchro Summon is performed, can I activate "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended"'s "when your opponent would Special Summon a monster(s)" effect?
Answer:
If "Tenpai Dragon Chundra"'s effect was activated as Chain Link 1, that effect of "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended" can be activated during the attempt to Synchro Summon; if the effect of "Tenpai Dragon Chundra" was activated as Chain Link 2 or higher, it cannot be.
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Tenpai Dragon Chundra", "Sauravis, the Ancient and Ascended"

Negate Summons.interaction: The normal and tribute summon performed by an effect that says "Immediately after this effect resolves, [method] Summon [X]" can be likewise negated if that effect was activated as Chain Link 1[].
Negate Summons.example:
Question:
When "Ehther the Heavenly Monarch" is Tribute Summoned immediately after resolving its own effect during my opponent's Main Phase, can the Tribute Summon be negated by "Solemn Judgment"?
Answer:
If "Ehther the Heavenly Monarch"'s effect was activated as Chain Link 1, "Solemn Judgment" can be activated during the attempt to Tribute Summon; if the effect of "Ehther the Heavenly Monarch" was activated as Chain Link 2 or higher, it cannot be.
Negate Summons.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Solemn Judgment", "Ehther the Heavenly Monarch"

Change Properties.interaction:
An effect (1) is applying that changes properties of monsters face-up on the field.
  • You can activate an effect (2) that summons back monsters (3) from a location (like the Graveyard) to the field and immediately after at resolution performs a Special Summon of a monster (4), as long as (3) and their properties satisfied the summoning requirements for (4) when (3) were in their original location (like the Graveyard).
  • But when (3) are summoned back to the field, as (1) is applying, if (1) changes (3)'s properties so that you can't summon (4) at resolution anymore, you must summon another monster that can be summoned with (3) after their properties have changed from the same location(s) of (4).
  • If there are no monsters that can be summoned from the location(s) of (4), after summoning back (3), (2) resolves without performing the Special Summon[].
Change Properties.example:
Question:
If my opponent has "Stygian Dirge" face-up on their side of the field, can I activate "Geargia Change"?
Answer:
Since the targeted ""Geargiano"" monsters are Level 3, as long as you are able to Xyz Summon a Rank 3 monster using the targeted monsters, you can still activate "Geargia Change".
In this scenario, since the Levels of the targeted monsters are reduced by 1 after being Special Summoned, you cannot Xyz Summon a Rank 3 monster, and you must instead Xyz Summon a Rank 2 monster if one exists in your Extra Deck.
At this time, if you do not have a Rank 2 monster in your Extra Deck, the Xyz Summon is not performed.
Change Properties.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Summon-immediately-after & monsters' properties changing after being Summoned

Unaffected.interaction: If you perform a summon due to an effect that says "immediately after this effect resolves, [method] Summon [X]", you can use monsters you control even if they are unaffected by cards effects[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
A face-up Attack Position "Galaxy Knight" is the only monster present on my field. When my opponent's "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" attacks my "Galaxy Knight", I activate the effect of "Galaxy Tyranno" in my hand and Special Summon it. Afterward, if I activate the other effect of "Galaxy Tyranno" that allows me to perform an Xyz Summon using "Galaxy" monsters on my field, but my opponent chains the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora" and makes "Galaxy Knight" unaffected by other card effects, can I still perform the Xyz Summon?
Answer:
In this scenario, although "Galaxy Knight" is made unaffected by other card effects by the effect of "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora", the effect of "Galaxy Tyranno" is not an effect that affects monsters on the field. Therefore, you can still perform the Xyz Summon using "Galaxy Knight" and "Galaxy Tyranno" as the Xyz Materials.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Number 81: Superdreadnought Rail Cannon Super Dora", "Galaxy Tyranno"

Unaffected.interaction: If you perform a summon due to an effect that says "immediately after this effect resolves, [method] Summon [X] ... using an opponent's monster", you cannot use that opponent's monster if it is unaffected by cards effects[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Unchained Soul of Rage"

Negate Activation of Cards.interaction: Negating a card's activation (not effect's activation) removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field[].
Negate Activation of Cards.example:
Question:
A "Super Soldier Shield" was set on the field by its own effect.
Afterwards, if that "Super Soldier Shield" is activated, and it has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit", is that "Super Soldier Shield" banished?
Answer:
In the proposed scenario, since the "Super Soldier Shield" that has its activation negated by "Seven Tools of the Bandit" is not considered to leave the field, it is not banished and is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard normally.
Negate Activation of Cards.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating a card's activation removes it from the field, but is not treated as leaving the field

Place a card on the field in your Spell/.interaction: Placing a monster on the field in a Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone is not treated as the monster "leaving the field". However, the effects of "Pumprincess the Princess of Ghosts", of "Dragunity Javelin", or of "Tiki Soul", may place destroyed monsters in the Spell & Trap Zone instead. In this case, that monster is treated as having left the field first[].
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.example:
Question:
The monster that was Special Summoned from my hand by "Relay Soul" is placed in my opponent's Spell & Trap Zone as an Equip Spell due to the effect of my opponent's "Relinquished Anima".
In this situation, what happens to "Relay Soul"'s "While it is face-up on your field, you take no damage." effect? Also, if that Monster Card in my opponent's Spell & Trap Zone is then later destroyed, does my opponent win the Duel due to "Relay Soul"'s text?
Answer:
If the monster that was Special Summoned by "Relay Soul"'s effect no longer exists in the Monster Zone, the "While it is face-up on your field, you take no damage." stops applying. Additionally, since that card is no longer treated as a monster, but is not treated as having left the field, your opponent will also not win the Duel.
This applies not only if a monster becomes an Equip Spell, but also if it becomes a Continuous Spell, or is placed in a Pendulum Zone. (These are not treated as it "leaving the field".)
However, the effects of the "Crystal Beast" monsters, of "Pumprincess the Princess of Ghosts", of "Dragunity Javelin", or of "Tiki Soul", may place destroyed monsters in the Spell & Trap Zone instead. In this case, that monster is treated as having left the field first. (If that monster was the monster Special Summoned by "Relay Soul"'s effect, your opponent will win the Duel.)
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Relay Soul" and monster moved to Spell & Trap Zone

Place a card on the field in your Spell/.interaction: Placing a monster on the field in a Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone is not treated as the monster "leaving the field". However, the effects of "Pumprincess the Princess of Ghosts", of "Dragunity Javelin", or of "Tiki Soul", may place destroyed monsters in the Spell & Trap Zone instead. In this case, that monster is treated as having left the field first[].
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.example:
Question:
The monster that was Special Summoned from my hand by "Relay Soul" is placed in my opponent's Spell & Trap Zone as an Equip Spell due to the effect of my opponent's "Relinquished Anima".
In this situation, what happens to "Relay Soul"'s "While it is face-up on your field, you take no damage." effect? Also, if that Monster Card in my opponent's Spell & Trap Zone is then later destroyed, does my opponent win the Duel due to "Relay Soul"'s text?
Answer:
If the monster that was Special Summoned by "Relay Soul"'s effect no longer exists in the Monster Zone, the "While it is face-up on your field, you take no damage." stops applying. Additionally, since that card is no longer treated as a monster, but is not treated as having left the field, your opponent will also not win the Duel.
This applies not only if a monster becomes an Equip Spell, but also if it becomes a Continuous Spell, or is placed in a Pendulum Zone. (These are not treated as it "leaving the field".)
However, the effects of the "Crystal Beast" monsters, of "Pumprincess the Princess of Ghosts", of "Dragunity Javelin", or of "Tiki Soul", may place destroyed monsters in the Spell & Trap Zone instead. In this case, that monster is treated as having left the field first. (If that monster was the monster Special Summoned by "Relay Soul"'s effect, your opponent will win the Duel.)
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Relay Soul" and monster moved to Spell & Trap Zone

Return/Shuffle to the Deck as an effect.interaction: When a monster on the field is shuffled into the Deck, it is no longer a card on the field, however its effects that activate when it "leaves the field" will not activate[]. Deck includes both Main and Extra Deck.

Unaffected.interaction: Negating an effect's activation affects the activating card[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
My opponent activates the effect of "Master Peace, the True Dracoslaying King" that destroys 1 other card on the field, while it is also unaffected by monster and Trap effects as a result of being Tribute Summoned by Tributing a monster and a Continuous Trap Card. In this case, if I chain "Recall", what happens?
Answer:
In this scenario, since "Master Peace, the True Dracoslaying King" is unaffected by Trap Cards, the activation of its effect is not negated by "Recall" and it is not destroyed, so its effect destroys the targeted card normally. Even in that case, your opponent draws 1 card.
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Negating an effect's activation affects the activating card

Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.interaction: A monster (1) activates its effect and an effect that returns cards to the hand (2) is chained to return (1) to the hand. Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be returned to the hand due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.example:
Question:
I chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to change to face-down Defense Position. Is the effect of "Judgment Dragon" negated?
Also, if I activated "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Also, if I activated "Compulsory Evacuation Device" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Answer:
