Due to the Chain resolving in reverse order, the effect of "Forbidden Chalice" will not be applied once "Judgment Dragon" changes to face-down Defense Position due to the effect of "Book of Moon", so the effect of "Judgment Dragon" will not be negated, and all other cards on the field will be destroyed.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is returned to the hand by the effect of "Compulsory Evacuation Device" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Effects negation, and what removes/doesn't remove it

Place a card on the field in your Spell/.interaction: If the effects of a card that places itself face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone when it is destroyed are being negated, that effect cannot be applied. If it is destroyed by battle or card effect it is sent to the Graveyard normally[].
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.example:
Question:
"Skill Drain" is face-up on the field, and its effect that negates the effects of all face-up monsters on the field is applying. In this situation, if a face-up "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle" on my field is destroyed by battle or card effect, can I place it in my Spell & Trap Zone as a Continuous Spell Card instead of sending it to the Graveyard?
Answer:
If the effects of "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle" are being negated, the effect that places it face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone as a Continuous Spell Card when it is destroyed cannot be applied. (A "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle" that is destroyed by battle or card effect is sent to the Graveyard normally.)
Place a card on the field in your Spell/.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Skill Drain", "Crystal Beast Ruby Carbuncle"

Change Properties.interaction: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value[].
Change Properties.example:
Question:
The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8.
Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated, what happens with the applied effect?
Answer:
In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel".
Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
(If you activate the "this card can make a second attack in a row" effect, it will be negated. If you activate the "target 1 card in your opponent's Graveyard; banish it" effect by Tributing another monster, it will be negated. If you activate that effect by Tributing "Infernoid Decatron" itself, it will not be negated.)
Similarly, the following monsters will also retain the card names they gained, even if their effects are negated after the effect in question has been applied: "Performapal Bot-Eyes Lizard", "Crystal Rose", "Genex Spare", and "Genex Recycled".
Change Properties.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Change Name.example:
Question:
The effect of "Infernoid Decatron" was activated, gaining the name and effects of "Infernoid Attondel" and increasing its Level by 8.
Afterwards if "Infernoid Decatron" has its effects negated by the effect of "Skill Drain" being activated, what happens with the applied effect?
Answer:
In the proposed scenario, the Level of "Infernoid Decatron" that was increased by 8 returns to the original value, but the gained name remains as "Infernoid Attondel".
Also, the gained effects of "Infernoid Attondel" remain gained, but they are negated by "Skill Drain".
(If you activate the "this card can make a second attack in a row" effect, it will be negated. If you activate the "target 1 card in your opponent's Graveyard; banish it" effect by Tributing another monster, it will be negated. If you activate that effect by Tributing "Infernoid Decatron" itself, it will not be negated.)
Similarly, the following monsters will also retain the card names they gained, even if their effects are negated after the effect in question has been applied: "Performapal Bot-Eyes Lizard", "Crystal Rose", "Genex Spare", and "Genex Recycled".
Change Name.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: When a monster's effects that gained the Level, name or effect of another monster are negated, then only the Level will return to its original value

Change Level/Rank.interaction: For monster effects that change Levels, if the effect can only be applied to the activating monster itself, that effect will cease to apply if the monster's effects are negated[].
Change Level/Rank.example:
Question:
I have activated and resolved the effect of my "Shooting Riser Dragon", and as I sent "Jet Synchron" to the Graveyard using it, the Level of "Shooting Riser Dragon" is currently reduced by 1.
If the effects of this "Shooting Riser Dragon" are now negated, such as by "Skill Drain"'s effect, what happens to "Shooting Riser Dragon"'s Level?
Answer:
The Level will return to the original value. (Note that "you cannot activate the effects of monsters with the same name the sent monster had in the Graveyard" still applies.)
For monster effects that change Levels, if the effect can only be applied to the activating monster itself, that effect will cease to apply if the monster's effects are negated.
Change Level/Rank.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Shooting Riser Dragon","Skill Drain", "Lyrilusc - Independent Nightingale", "F.A. Dawn Dragster", "Cyber Dragon Herz"

Change Level/Rank.interaction: If a monster in the Spell/Trap/Pendulum Zone has an effect that special summons itself and has its level increased, or decreased, the increase or decrease is done by its own Spell/Trap/Pendulum Effect. Therefore, even if that monster effects are subsequently negated, the Level of that monster will remain at the changed value[].
Change Level/Rank.example:
Question:
I have Special Summoned "D/D/D Vice King Requiem" from the Pendulum Zone using its first Pendulum Effect, and as a result, its Level was reduced by 1.
If "Skill Drain" now begins applying, negating the monster effects of that "D/D/D Vice King Requiem", what happens to its Level?
Answer:
The Special Summoned "D/D/D Vice King Requiem" has its level increased, or decreased, by its own Pendulum Effect (i.e., a Spell effect).
Therefore, even if the monster effects of that "D/D/D Vice King Requiem" are subsequently negated by "Skill Drain", the Level of that "D/D/D Vice King Requiem" will remain at the changed value. (In the situation described, the Level will remain lowered by 1.)
Change Level/Rank.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "D/D/D Vice King Requiem", "Skill Drain"

Change Level/Rank.interaction: Another example being "Centur-Ion Trudea": the effect that Special Summons itself is a Continuous Trap effect, therefore even if the effects of this card are later negated, its Level will not return to the original value[].
Change Level/Rank.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Centur-Ion Trudea"

Properties Changing - Gains this effect.interaction: A monster (1) on the field has gained an effect due to another card or effect (2). The gained effect will be treated as the monster effect of (1). If (1)'s effect is negated, (1) will still gain the effect by (2), but it will be negated. If (1) is no longer negated, the gained effect will start to apply normally[].
Properties Changing - Gains this effect.example:
Question:
"Skill Drain" is face-up on the field. In this situation, if I activate "Rank-Up-Magic Cipher Ascension" and Special Summon a "Neo Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Dragon" with its effect, will it also gain 500 ATK for each Level 4 or higher monster on my field?
Answer:
When "Rank-Up-Magic Cipher Ascension" resolves, the Special Summoned "Neo Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Dragon" gains the effect "This card gains 500 ATK for each Level 4 or higher monster you control." This effect will be treated as the monster effect of "Neo Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Dragon".
Therefore, while the effect of "Skill Drain" is applying, "Neo Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Dragon" will still gain this effect when Special Summoned by "Rank-Up-Magic Cipher Ascension", but it will be negated.
(If the effect of "Skill Drain" stops applying, the gained effect will start to apply normally.)
Properties Changing - Gains this effect.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Neo Galaxy-Eyes Cipher Dragon", "Rank-Up-Magic Cipher Ascension", "Skill Drain"

Then an effect that negates monster's effects (3) is chained to negate (1). The Chain resolves in reverse order, the effect of (3) will be applied and (1) will be returned to the hand due to the effect of (2), and the effect of (1) will still be negated[].
Return/Add to the Hand as an effect.example:
Question:
I chained "Book of Moon" to the activation of the effect of "Judgment Dragon", and then further chained "Forbidden Chalice". In this case, the Chain resolving in reverse order causes the "Judgment Dragon" that was affected by "Forbidden Chalice" to change to face-down Defense Position. Is the effect of "Judgment Dragon" negated?
Also, if I activated "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?
Also, if I activated "Compulsory Evacuation Device" in a chain to the effect of "Judgment Dragon", would the effect be negated?

Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is banished by the effect of "Interdimensional Matter Transporter" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.
Also, if "Judgment Dragon" is returned to the hand by the effect of "Compulsory Evacuation Device" as the Chain resolves in reverse order, its effect will be negated.

This turn/For the rest of the turn/Until.interaction: A face-up card has applied an effect that lasts for this turn. If in this same turn that card has its effects negated, the previously applied effect will still linger for the turn[].
This turn/For the rest of the turn/Until.example:
Question:
I successfully Fusion Summoned a "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride" and activated its effect this turn. If "Skill Drain" is activated after it resolved, how is the effect applied?
Answer:
If "Skill Drain" is activated after the effect of "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride" has resolved, and its effects are negated, "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride" will no longer lose 1000 ATK, but it will still be able to attack directly with its effect that turn.
This turn/For the rest of the turn/Until.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Prank-Kids Rocket Ride", "Skill Drain"

Traps Treated as Monsters (not treated a.interaction: Even when a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card which says it is not treated as a Trap Card has its effects negated, it remains in the Main Monster Zone[].

Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.interaction:
• After you negate monster effects of a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card, its Trap Effect that it applies to itself is not negated, so the card remains in the Monster Zone[].
  • After you negate trap effects of a Trap Card treated as a Monster Card, its Trap Effect that is applied to itself is negated, so it is no longer treated as a monster and cannot exist in the Monster Zone. Thus, it will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone face-up (even if the negation effect is no longer applied, the Trap Card will not be Special Summoned to the Monster Zone again)[].
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.example:
Question:
I control an "Angel Statue - Azurune" Special Summoned as a monster by its own effect. What happens to "Angel Statue - Azurune" each in each the following scenarios?
â’¶: A previously-Set "Infinite Impermanence", targeting another monster, resolves in the same column as "Angel Statue - Azurune".
â’·: "Infinite Impermanence", targeting "Angel Statue - Azurune", resolves in a different column from it.
Answer:
In the given situation, a Continuous Trap Card that has an effect of becoming a monster, such as "Angel Statue - Azurune", has been Special Summoned to your Monster Zone by applying its own Trap Effect.
â’¶: "Angel Statue - Azurune" will be placed face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone.
If the effect of a previously Set "Infinite Impermanence" that negates all other Spell/Trap effects in its column is applied to "Angel Statue - Azurune" in the Monster Zone, its Trap Effect that is applied to itself is negated, so it is no longer treated as a monster and cannot exist in the Monster Zone. Thus, it will be placed in the Spell & Trap Zone face-up. (The particular Zone is chosen by its controller. If there is no appropriate Zone, it is sent to the Graveyard. This is not treated as it being sent to the Graveyard by a card effect.)
Even if the effect of "Infinite Impermanence" then stops applying, "Angel Statue - Azurune" will not be Special Summoned to the Monster Zone again.
â’·: "Angel Statue - Azurune" remains in the Monster Zone.
If the effect of "Infinite Impermanence" that negates the effects of its target applies to "Angel Statue - Azurune" that is treated as an Effect Monster, only its Monster Effects will be negated. Its Trap Effect that it applies to itself is not negated.
Traps Treated as Monsters (still treated.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Infinite Impermanence", "Angel Statue - Azurune"

Unaffected.interaction: Since the effect of a monster that makes itself unaffected by other card effects is a Continuous Effect, it is not applied when its Special Summon is negated[].
Unaffected.example:
Question:
When "Timaeus the Knight of Destiny" is being Special Summoned by its own method, can "Solemn Judgment" negate the Summon? Or does the first effect of "Timaeus the Knight of Destiny" make it unaffected by the effect of "Solemn Judgment"?
Answer:
The Special Summon of "Timaeus the Knight of Destiny" can be negated by "Solemn Judgment". Since the effect of "Timaeus the Knight of Destiny" that makes it unaffected by other card effects is a Continuous Effect, it is not applied when the Special Summon is negated by "Solemn Judgment".
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Timaeus the Knight of Destiny", "Solemn Judgment"

Substitute for any 1 Fusion Material.interaction: If a card "Fusion Summons a Fusion Monster that lists [X] as material", it must use a material requirement that meets [X], and must also use a monster that meets [X] to meet that specific requirement[].
Substitute for any 1 Fusion Material.example:
Question:
I control a "Goddess with the Third Eye" (LIGHT) and a "Fallen of Albaz" (DARK).
If I now resolve "Branded Fusion", can I Fusion Summon "Lubellion the Searing Dragon", which lists "1 DARK monster + ""Fallen of Albaz""" as the necessary material?
Answer:
No, you cannot.
When performing a Fusion Summon using "Branded Fusion", you must use a monster named ""Fallen of Albaz"" for the ""Fallen of Albaz"" that is listed as the Fusion Monster's material.
In other words, you can use either "Fallen of Albaz" itself, or a "Albion the Shrouded Dragon" whose name is treated as ""Fallen of Albaz"", as ""Fallen of Albaz"" for the Fusion Summon. You cannot use "Goddess with the Third Eye". (The effect of "Goddess with the Third Eye" allows it to substitute for a Fusion Material, but does not change its name.) The same applies to using "King of the Swamp" in place of "Goddess with the Third Eye".
Substitute for any 1 Fusion Material.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: If a card "Fusion Summons a Fusion Monster that lists [X] as material", it must use a material requirement that meets [X], and must also use a monster that meets [X] to meet that specific requirement

Unaffected by activated effects.interaction: Continuous/lingering effects that begin applying when the Chain Link formed by the card activation resolves, these effects will continue to apply to monsters afterwards. Therefore, these effects can affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects"[].
Unaffected by activated effects.example:
Question:
My opponent controls a "Cyberdark End Dragon", which is "unaffected by your opponent's (= my) activated effects".
What happens if the effects of "Skill Drain", "Crackdown", or "Dimensional Barrier", or "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect, are applied in this situation?
Answer:
The effects of "Skill Drain" and "Dimensional Barrier" will negate the effects of "Cyberdark End Dragon", and the effect of "Crackdown" will take control of "Cyberdark End Dragon". "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s effect will destroy "Cyberdark End Dragon" during the End Phase.
Monsters which are "unaffected by activated effects" will be unaffected by any effect that is applied when the Chain Link formed by an activation resolves. However, any other effect will apply to them normally.
On the other hand, while the effects of "Skill Drain", "Crackdown", and "Dimensional Barrier" respectively are effects that begin applying when the Chain Link formed by the card activation resolves, these effects will continue to apply to monsters afterwards. Therefore, these effects can affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects".
Similarly, "Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon"'s "destroy all monsters your opponent controls during the End Phase of this turn" effect also applies after the Chain Link formed by its activation has finished resolving. Therefore, it can also affect monsters that are "unaffected by activated effects".
Unaffected by activated effects.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Unaffected by activated effects" and what it means

During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.interaction: An effect that resolves at a later point, moving a card(s) in the GY to a different place, can be activated when "Necrovalley" is face-up on the field and its effect will not be negated. If at the time of the delayed effect resolution "Necrovalley" is still face-up on the field, that effect won't resolve successfully and won't move any card in the GY. If on the other hand "Necrovalley" is not face-up on the field anymore, then that effect resolves normally by moving a card(s) in the GY[].
During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.example:
Question:
"Necrovalley" is face-up in my opponent's Field Zone. In this situation, if I Normal or Special Summon "Harpie Oracle" and activate its effect, will it be negated?
Answer:
Even if "Harpie Oracle" is Normal or Special Summoned and activates its effect while the effect of "Necrovalley" is applying, as in this scenario, the effect will not be negated.
However, if the effect of "Necrovalley" is applying during the End Phase when you apply "Harpie Oracle"'s effect, you cannot add an appropriate Spell/Trap Card from your Graveyard to your hand.
(If the effect of "Necrovalley" has stopped applying by the time you reach the End Phase, you can add the Spell/Trap Card from your Graveyard to your hand normally.)
During the [X] Phase, do [A] - Delayed e.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: Necrovalley and delayed effects

Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.interaction: The player who takes damage from the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" is the one who controls the targeted monster when it leaves the field[].
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.example:
Question:
When my opponent Special Summoned "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon" this turn, I activated the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill". During the same turn, if that "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon" leaves the field after its control was changed by the effect of "Creature Swap", which player takes damage?
Answer:
The player who takes damage from the effect of "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" is the one who controls the targeted monster when it leaves the field. (In this scenario, since you were the controller of "Blue-Eyes Alternative White Dragon", you take 3000 damage.)
Change/Take/Give/Switch Control.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" and changing control

Unaffected.interaction: You can use "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" targeting a monster unaffected by cards effects. In this scenario, the monster's effects won't be negated but the controller of that monster will still take damage when it leaves the field[].
Unaffected.reference: • YGOrg Database of Official OCG Rulings: "Ghost Mourner & Moonlit Chill" targets a monster that is unaffected
